Vi söker dig med en stark teknisk kompetens och en brinnande passion för att leverera värde genom stabil och säker IT. Här får du jobba med avancerade Microsoftlösningar både på server och klientnivå i en långsiktig tjänst.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, långsiktigt
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vi söker dig med en stark teknisk kompetens och en brinnande passion för att leverera värde genom stabil och säker IT. Hos vår kund får du inte bara möjligheten att fortsätta utvecklas inom ditt område, utan också chansen att vara en nyckelspelare i vår kunds framgångssaga. Företaget är en organisation med ICT-lösningar i teknikens framkant och produkter och tjänster av hög kvalitet.
 


  


 Som IT-drifttekniker hos vår kund, kommer du att ingå i ett dedikerat team som har ansvaret för att sköta den tekniska förvaltningen och driften av kritiska sourcingtjänster. Genom att följa ITIL-standarden och använda din expertis inom konfiguration, drift och felsökning av IT-infrastruktur, kommer du att säkerställa att våra kunder upplever en sömlös och effektiv IT-drift.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En långsiktig tjänst som inleds som ett konsult uppdrag genom Academic Work men där tanken är att man blir anställd direkt hos företaget på sikt
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Djupgående erfarenhet av arbete med Windows Server OS i samtliga versioner
  
* Avancerade kunskaper i konfiguration och felsökning av Windows-operativsystem
  
* Kompetens inom Active Directory Services inklusive DNS, ADFS, NPS, PKI och certifikat
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverksteknik
  
* Färdigheter i Script och PowerShell
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Certifieringar inom Microsoftprodukter
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Ansvarstagande**
  
* **Social**
  
* **Ordningsam**
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107446

title: Office Support / Office Manager
description:
**Dekiru söker OFFICE SUPPORT / OFFICE MANAGER** 




  





**OM OSS** 




 Vi söker dig som vill underlätta för oss i vårt dagliga arbete på Stockholmskontoret. Dekiru är ett IT-företag med erfarna konsulter som arbetar med applikations och integrationsutveckling. Vi finns i Stockholm, Göteborg och Visby och är 17 medarbetare. Det som driver oss är teknologi, arbetsglädje och nöjda kunder. Läs mera på www.dekiru.se. 
 



  





**ROLLEN** 




 I rollen som Office support/Office manager förväntar vi oss att du - ser till att servicen fungerar på kontoret genom att hålla ordning och reda, och måna om trivseln - medverkar i våra ekonomiprocesser genom att administrera och registrera t ex fakturor och betalningar. Detta görs i samarbete med redovisningskonsult och VD. 
 



 Vi vill att du:
 


* stödjer oss i vårt dagliga arbete, genom t ex att planera och förbereda inför möten och events
* hanterar inköp och leverantörskontakter
* liksom oss gillar att förenkla arbetet med digitala verktyg
* sist men inte minst avlastar vår VD med både stort och smått



 Vi tror att tjänstens omfattning är ca 50 % av heltid, med fysisk närvaro mån-fre t ex 09.00-14.00, då kontinuitet och tillgänglighet är viktig. Tjänstens innehåll kan utvecklas utifrån våra behov och vad du har för ambitioner.
 



  





**DU SOM PERSON** 




 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, gärna tar initiativ och gillar att lösa problem. Stora som små. Du har lätt för att kommunicera i tal och skrift. De administrativa uppgifterna kräver organisationsförmåga och ordningssinne. Du kan vara utbildad inom ekonomi, marknad och/eller administration. Din arbetslivserfarenhet kan vara från kontor, hotell/konferens eller liknande. Om du har arbetat tillsammans med IT-konsulter är det också värdefullt.
 



  





 Vi hoppas att du har blivit intresserad av oss och hör av dig genom att skicka din cv och ett personligt brev. Eller om du har frågor, slår en signal. 
 



  





 Martin Lewin, VD
 



 martin.lewin@dekiru.se
 



 0733-98 59 69

title: Configuration Manager
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
PostNord Group AB is a leading provider of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region. The Nordic Support department is responsible for enabling and ensuring the service management in Group function IT. The unit contributes with designing processes, concepts and implementing them in the service management areas to ensure that the processes provide desired business result.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at one of the Nordic region´s largest companies? If you work as a Configuration Manager or Transition Manager and are interested in developing IT processes this is the job for you!
   

  

 The Configuration Manager is responsible for overseeing the configuration management process within an organization's IT environment. This role involves maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of configuration items (CIs), managing configuration baselines, and ensuring that changes to the IT infrastructure are controlled and documented. The Configuration Manager plays a vital role in supporting other IT service management (ITSM) processes, such as change management and incident management, by providing a reliable and consistent configuration management database (CMDB).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Coordinate Configuration Management: Oversee all configuration management activities, including designing, implementing, and managing configuration management process.
* Coordinate Transition management: Oversee all transition management activities, including developing, executing and managing transition plans
* Manage Change Control: Control changes to configuration items and documentation to ensure system integrity.
* Maintain Documentation: Keep accurate records of system configurations, dependencies, and relationships.
* Ensure Compliance: Conduct audits to verify adherence to the configuration management plan.
* Collaborate with Teams: Work with various teams to implement the configuration management plan effectively.
* Monitor Performance: Track problems and changes in product documents, reporting updates and current configurations.


**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* A couple of years of work experience within configuration management or transition management or a related role.
* University degree or similar, in relevant field (Computer Science, logistics or technology/IT).
* Process Management framework Knowledge & certification (ITIL).
* English in speaking and writing


**System requirement:**
* JIRA SM
* Microsoft Office (including visio)
* Sharepoint


**Meritorious experience:**
* Configuration Management experience preferably in a complex and large IT landscape
* Transition management experience in cloud applications


 We believe you have strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling you to clearly articulate ideas and foster meaningful relationships with others. Furthermore, your strong analytical and problem-solving abilities empower you to navigate complex challenges and deliver creative, effective solutions.
   

  

**We Offer You** 
 :
   

  

* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord´s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus
* Great occupational pension terms
* Great development opportunities


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. In this recruitment, PostNord collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75 and Pia Boström pia.bostrom@se.experis.com, +46 70-3146866
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application! The last application date, 2024-10-14
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!

title: IT Service Portfolio Manager
description:
Are you collaborative and eager to drive improvements within IT service management? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Sandvik Coromant, we’re now looking for an IT Service Portfolio Manager to join our small and dedicated team focused on supporting our IT teams, ensuring they’re productive and equipped with efficient tools and effective work methods. We welcome you to an international environment that provides great opportunities for both personal and professional development!
   

  

**Your mission**
 In this position, you manage our IT service portfolio by working closely with the IT System owners and Application Management teams across our organization – supporting them to efficiently manage our IT services throughout their lifecycle. You focus both on the operational and the financial perspectives of our IT services to ensure they meet business needs. With support from the IT Service Management team at Sandvik Group, you promote effective use of ITIL processes, and you develop and maintain our IT Service portfolio, including measurement of critical KPI’s. You organize the IT System owner community to spread news and knowledge about our IT Service Management platform and to enable cross-functional collaboration and learning.
   

  

 The location for this position is Sandviken or Stockholm and we apply a hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine office and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with a relevant education or equivalent knowledge gained from a working career. You have a background in managing or coordinating development and support of IT applications. Experience from ServiceNow or a similar IT Service Management platform is considered a plus. Acting in a global environment calls for excellent skills in English, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You’re self-driven and collaborative, with the ability to build networks effectively. You enjoy communicating with others, both painting the broad picture and going into necessary details to inspire motivation and commitment.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Stig Jeppsson, recruiting manager, at +46 (0)70-542 95 36
   

  

 We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts:
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Hanna Thomas
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than October 24, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0071521.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 staff and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Director, Digital Growth
description:
*Are you passionate about digital strategy, marketing, and technology? Do you thrive on setting ambitious goals and making impactful decisions that fuel success? Are you ready to join one of the fastest-growing digital consultancies in the Nordics?*




 Then keep reading! We’re looking for a Director to Digital Growth, eager to play a key role in shaping and driving digital growth for our clients.
 



  





**Manage a dynamic portfolio of clients and lead strategic decisions that elevate our clients to the next level** 




 As the Director of Digital Growth, you will have overall responsibility for our digital growth business area in Sweden, acting as the main driver behind strategic decisions and initiatives to take our clients to the next level.
 



 Your key responsibilities will include:
 


* Leading and developing the Digital Growth business area in Sweden.
* Managing and growing a personal client portfolio, predominantly as a strategic sponsor, with deeper involvement as needed.
* Playing a pivotal role in client pitches, leveraging insights and experience in media and performance marketing for retail and brands.
* Driving the launch and market introduction of new solutions/products in Sweden.
* Establishing and executing effective service models and core solutions, with a focus on media planning and growth strategy.
* Working closely with teams across international offices to steer the commercial agenda, product innovation, and go-to-market strategies.
* Generating leads and leveraging your personal network.



  





**Join our team!** 




 As the Director of Digital Growth, you will be part of daily life at our Stockholm office, working alongside a team of specialists in SEO, Paid Social, and Paid Search. While we love connecting and collaborating in the office, we also value flexibility, empowering you to design a workday that suits your personal preferences.
 



 You will report directly to the Managing Director, Seve Michel, and work closely with colleagues across various countries and departments. Together, we share a common goal: delivering exceptional results for our clients by continuously adapting, expanding our offerings, and staying ahead of the curve.
 



  





**Strategic thinker with a strong toolkit** 




 Since you’ll play a key role in developing our Digital Growth business unit in Sweden, we’re looking for a colleague who can set direction, drive innovative strategies, and deliver outstanding results.
 



 You will also bring:
 


* Excellent communication and presentation skills in both Swedish and English.
* Experience in crafting appealing narratives with a cohesive storyline through Google Slides/PPT.
* A commercial and growth mindset, with experience managing complex and senior clients, preferably within retail and brands.
* A deep understanding of digital marketing strategy, including data and adtech.
* 3+ years of agency experience, preferably in similar roles or within performance marketing.
* A proven track record of delivering on sales and growth targets.
* Strong connections and experience in the Swedish market.
* A deep sense of ownership for everything you do.



 Even though you bring several years of experience, we prioritize your development. You can expect continuous feedback and guidance from inspiring leaders and colleagues, along with an unstoppable drive to improve and think innovatively.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 At s360, we live by our values:
 *Down to earth, To the point, Eager to improve,* 
 and
 *Act with integrity.*
 Our culture is defined by learning, collaboration, and innovation. We facilitate knowledge-sharing sessions across departments and offices. As pioneers in tech and AI, we are excited to be on the cutting edge of the latest trends. Innovation is not just about staying ahead—it’s who we are, and it drives our commitment to excellence.
 



 We also place a strong focus on employee well-being, offering flexible working arrangements and comprehensive healthcare.
 



  





**We’d love to hear from you!** 




 Does this sound like the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Managing Director, Seve Michel, at 070-4026095.
 



 We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.
 



  





**Who is s360?** 




 s360 is an award-winning Performance Marketing Agency founded in Denmark with over 300 employees across the Nordics, UK, and the Netherlands. We specialize in data-driven digital marketing and assist ambitious companies like POWER, XXL, and HSNG in crafting measurable digital strategies.

title: Juniora konsulter till IT risk – Aug 2025
description:
Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

 Vi identifierar och analyserar risker samt granskar och utvärderar hur de identifierade riskerna hanteras. Våra klienter får därigenom hjälp att förstå sina IT-relaterade risker och en bild av hur de påverkar företagets operativa och finansiella delar. Våra klienter är huvudsakligen stora, Nordiska och Globala bolag. Uppdragens längd varierar från ett par veckor till ett par månader och i vissa fall ännu längre. Oberoende av tjänsteområde och uppdragsform arbetar vi alltid i team.
   





 Som Consultant inom IT, Data & Analytics, kommer du att fokusera på uppdrag av granskningskaraktär och gap-analyser relaterade till IT-risk. Genom mixen av tjänster vi erbjuder och våra klienters föränderliga behov, kommer du över tid att bygga upp en bred erfarenhetsbas som spänner över många olika perspektiv av granskning och rådgivning inom IT-risk. Detta hjälper dig att utveckla förmågor som matchar senaste trenderna och teknikutvecklingen i samklang med marknadens behov.
   

  

  




**Kvalifikationer**

 Vi söker dig som är nyutexaminerad inom antigen systemvetenskap, datavetenskap, datorteknik, informatik, informationssäkerhet eller är ingenjör eller ekonom med IT-inriktning. Magister eller masterutbildning är meriterande. Vi söker dig med goda studieresultat och vi ser gärna att du har varit aktiv under dina studier med extrajobb, studiesociala engagemang eller dylikt. Extrajobb inom ekonomi eller IT är meriterande.
   





 Du är en lagspelare, men trivs även med att jobba självständigt. Du är flexibel, lösningsorienterad, analytisk och öppen för nya utmaningar.
   

  

  




**Ytterligare information**

**Vi erbjuder**




 Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och på en revisionsavdelning i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär och kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.
   





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.
   





**Ansökan**




 Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:
   




* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen som konsult
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.



 Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval.
   





 Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut: https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/. För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg, genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.
   





**Frågor**




 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johannes Forgaard, jeikforgaard@deloitte.se.
   





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Azurearkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Vi är öppna – är du?**
 Är du redo att vara en del av framtidens molnlösningar? Vår verksamhet inom Azure Services växer, och vi söker nu efter fler underbara kollegor som brinner för att utveckla, designa och implementera systemlösningar i Azure!
   

  

 Som Azurearkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med både publika och privata molnlösningar där du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla lösningar på Azure-stacken. Arbetet kommer variera mellan olika plattformarna där integration kommer vara en återkommande del. På Redpill Linpro värdesätter vi samarbete och du kommer att arbeta nära andra kollegor för att göra en verklig skillnad för samhället, tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen känner du dig bekväm med att designa system som tar hänsyn till framtida förändringar. Du tänker proaktivt och har förståelse för att affärsprocesser ska tas hänsyn till innan du ger dig på tekniken. Vidare förstår du skillnaden mellan att jobba ”agilt” och att designa ett "agilt" system. Du vill lära dig nya saker och är bekväm med att ifrågasätta dina egna lösningar. Du frågar inte efter en färdig kravspecifikation men är villig att ta fram denna tillsammans med kunden.
   

  

**Som Azurearkitekt hos oss kommer du att arbeta med:**
* Ta fram krav tillsammans med kunden
* Identifiera ”core use-cases” utifrån framtagna krav
* Ta fram arkitektur på en konceptuell nivå och föreslå dens möjliga realiseringar
* Ta fram kostnadskalkyler och motivera val av tekniker
* Serverless teknologier
* Container lösningar
* Meddelandebaserade kommunikationsteknologier (ServiceBus, EventHub, etc)
* Diverse storage lösningar (SQL, Cosmos, Blob etc.)
* API design och livscykel
* DevOps
* C#, .NET, Typescript, Javascript eller Java


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utveckla dig inom nya områden och ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och delar värderingen att samarbete är det som tar oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver detta ser vi att du uppfyller följande:**
* Har några års erfarenhet av utveckling, arkitektur eller liknande arbete
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Du har varit med/ansvarat för kommunikationen med affärssidan för att förstå vad det är för system man bygger och vem man bygger det för


**Meriter:**
* Du har gått kurser som ges av iDesign eller Barry O'Reilly på DF Kompetens.
* Du är certifierad arkitekt
* Du har tidigare suttit med konsultarbete eller tagit fram kravställning hos kunder


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Javautvecklare till vårt Stockholmskontor
description:
**Är Java din expertis och du vill jobba med ett gäng där du får ett bra kompetensutbyte?** 
**Roliga projekt, duktiga kollegor och utveckling – det får du hos oss!**
 Frontwalker är en växande IT-koncern med bred geografisk spridning i Sverige. Frontwalker Stockholm tillsammans med Frontwalker Group är idag 50+ anställda och vi finns på fyra orter i landet. Hos oss hittar du vassa medarbetare inom systemutveckling, IT Management, kravanalys, test och mycket mer. Du blir en del av ett gäng där vi tillsammans arbetar för att driva och utveckla digitala affärer, mjukvara och människor.
   

  

 Vi arbetar både med inhouse projekt på vårt kontor och i våra kunders projekt som specialister!
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker en skicklig programmerare som vill jobba med databehandling i Javabaserade system. Vi ser gärna att du har en akademisk bakgrund eller motsvarande kunskaper.
   

  

 Du kommer få arbeta ganska fritt och utveckla och göra skillnad både på egen hand och i team. Det är viktigt att du gillar att samarbeta, både att bjuda på dina kunskaper och att ta till dig andras.
   

  

 Vi vill att du både kan ta till dig ny teknik när så krävs men också vara beredd att jobba med att underhålla äldre system, kundens behov styr. Du behöver ha kapacitet att förstå stora komplexa system med många beroenden och ha ett säkerhetstänk som en naturlig del av ditt arbete. Förutom programmeringskunskaper behöver du ha goda kunskaper i datamodellering och SQL. Vi ser helst att du har vana att arbeta i Linuxbaserade system. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av molnlösningar, fördelaktigt AWS. Det är meriterande om du har vana att arbeta med Docker, Kubernetes och Frontendramverk. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av fintech. Utöver det talar och skriver du obehindrat på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

* En inkluderande arbetsplats
* Work-life balance kultur
* Interna utvecklingsmöjligheter samt kompetensutveckling
* Marknadsmässig lön
* Bra förmåner i form av friskvård, försäkringar osv
* Flexibla arbetstider
* Sist men inte minst – att ha kul på jobbet


 Hos oss ingår du i en grupp med riktigt vassa och duktiga kollegor och du får möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt inom såväl olika myndigheter som inom det privata näringslivet. Vår verksamhet bygger till stor del på kunder som vi har mångåriga relationer med. Därför har de i många fall gett oss förtroendet att bedriva förvaltning och nyutveckling av deras system som inhouse-projekt, samtidigt som vi har rena resursuppdrag. Du kan komma att få det bästa av båda världar!
   

  

 Vi är ett socialt gäng i olika åldrar som gärna umgås och har kul ihop, spelar en pingis på rasten eller ses på aktiviteter efter jobbet - det hoppas vi att du också uppskattar. Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
   

  

**Vill du vara en Frontwalker?**
 Vad väntar du på? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande. Vid frågor om rekryteringen är du välkommen att kontakta Carolina Gustavson på 073 505 42 34 eller mejla till rekrytering@frontwalker.se. Notera att vi inte tar emot några ansökningar via mail.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen att höra av dig!

title: IT Service Portfolio Manager
description:
Are you collaborative and eager to drive improvements within IT service management? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Sandvik Coromant, we’re now looking for an IT Service Portfolio Manager to join our small and dedicated team focused on supporting our IT teams, ensuring they’re productive and equipped with efficient tools and effective work methods. We welcome you to an international environment that provides great opportunities for both personal and professional development!
   

  

**Your mission**
 In this position, you manage our IT service portfolio by working closely with the IT System owners and Application Management teams across our organization – supporting them to efficiently manage our IT services throughout their lifecycle. You focus both on the operational and the financial perspectives of our IT services to ensure they meet business needs. With support from the IT Service Management team at Sandvik Group, you promote effective use of ITIL processes, and you develop and maintain our IT Service portfolio, including measurement of critical KPI’s. You organize the IT System owner community to spread news and knowledge about our IT Service Management platform and to enable cross-functional collaboration and learning.
   

  

 The location for this position is Sandviken or Stockholm and we apply a hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine office and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with a relevant education or equivalent knowledge gained from a working career. You have a background in managing or coordinating development and support of IT applications. Experience from ServiceNow or a similar IT Service Management platform is considered a plus. Acting in a global environment calls for excellent skills in English, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You’re self-driven and collaborative, with the ability to build networks effectively. You enjoy communicating with others, both painting the broad picture and going into necessary details to inspire motivation and commitment.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Stig Jeppsson, recruiting manager, at +46 (0)70-542 95 36
   

  

 We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts:
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Hanna Thomas
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than October 24, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0071521.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 staff and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Delivery Manager - Technical Onboarding
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Role** 





 The merchant onboarding & life-cycle team plays a crucial part in ensuring that our clients are onboarded quickly and with high integration quality with Trustly, which is one of the company's highest priorities. As our Delivery Manager, you will support Trustly clients across all our businesses (E-commerce, Financial Services, Gaming, and Travel) during the onboarding process. Our team is currently based in Stockholm, London, and Malta, and together, we ensure that our clients have a smooth experience while they implement our products and solutions quickly and with high quality.
 









  




**What you’ll do** 
* Guide the clients to implementing the most suitable Trustly product solution by becoming an expert on Trustly’s products and architecture
* Manage multiple clients simultaneously, balancing business-level and technical conversations across different client organization levels. Support our commercial teams in technical discussions with our clients
* Conducting rigorous testing in both UAT (User Acceptance Testing), UX verification, and production environments to ensure flawless integration and smooth transaction processing
* Analyze, monitor, and interpret client performance the first 30-60 days when going live with Trustly and collaborate across Trustly teams to resolve issues and increase effectiveness. This includes driving customer optimization discussions with the client  – UX improvements, best practices, etc
* Be in contact with our clients via video call, messaging or email, and occasionally on-site during workshops and demos
* Ensure a smooth handoff from pre-sales to post-sales



  




**Who you are** 
* You have 3+ years of experience working in a technical role (preferably fintech/online payments) and have a solid understanding of API integrations, and the ability to explain API concepts to both technical and non-technical customer stakeholders
* Detail-oriented and data-driven; ability to understand data sets and leverage this data to drive customer outcomes and adoption
* A passion for technology and problem-solving and an aptitude to learn quickly and rapidly build domain and product knowledge at Trustly
* You are service-minded and customer-focused. Ability to leverage your business acumen to assess client needs and drive outcomes
* Great verbal and written communication skills. Ability to successfully manage multiple client interactions independently, at all levels, with high quality and grace under pressure
* Excellent collaborator with the skills needed to engage across multiple teams (Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Risk, Support) and multiple geographies to drive the outcomes needed to ensure success


 Bonus if you have 
 * Prior experience at a growth-stage internet/software company (preferably fintech/online payments)
* Experience with tools like Qlik or Tableau
* Prior experience working with enterprise companies as well as tech-savvy start-ups
* Proven project management skills or a strong desire to build those skills
* Experience working towards the German market or if you are German-speaking






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: AI Product Specialist to fast growing company
description:
Are you "the engineering type" and enjoying discussing AI solutions with other people. Do you have a deep knowledge about AI and preferably embedded systems, then this might be the perfect role for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm City
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Grönt jobb
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a fast growing company within the AI and embedded systems industry and are part of one of the worlds largest organisations in producing semiconductors. As they are growing their business they need to hire someone that will work in their sales department adding that extra technical knowledge and engineering mindset.
 


  


 An AI Product Specialist has deep knowledge of the company’s AI-products and technologies, as well as the ability to communicate technical details to customers in an easily understandable way. The focus is to explain and promote the products and concepts, but also educating and supporting customers, which means helping them utilize the product optimally through, for example, workshops and technical training. This also requires an understanding of the customers' business processes and how your AI products can be integrated with them.
 


  


 In this role you will work alongside your colleagues that are bringing in new clients and you will provide them with education and expertise in your products. A typical day for you will probably contain one or a couple of sales meetings with clients talking about your products and how they work. Then you might move on to preparing and hosting a webinar for another client. And in all your tasks you will make use of your technical knowledge and understanding about AI.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **To work for a company with cutting edge technology in AI and embedded systems**
  
* **A consultant assignment with the ultimate goal to be hired directly at the company**
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Promote the products to clients
  
* Give clients expert guidance in how your AI products can be leveraged by them
  
* Educate clients in how your product works through webinars and workshops
  
* Do technical demonstrations of how the products work
  
* Write technical documentation, web content and marketing material
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* A deep interest and understanding for AI solutions from prior work experience and/or education
  
* An interest in talking about AI technologies for clients and partners
  
* Fluent in English as the company language in English
  
* Education: MsC in engineering within IT and preferably AI
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience and knowledge in embedded systems
  
* Experience from working in a customer-facing role B2B
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Nils Norgren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107596

title: Hands on E-commerce manager
description:
*Sales driven person who is passionate about e-commerce who wants to join the growth journey at Under Your Skin.* 




  






 Under Your Skin is one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies, appointed to rising star in 2023. The company is founded by the mother- and daughter duo Christina and Lovisa Hahn, with the vision to eliminate toxic chemicals in hair- and skincare on a global market. 
 




  






 Under Your Skin is currently in a growth phase with international expansion to be launched both in Europe and the US. A strong global organization is being built and we
 

 are seeking a new e-commerce manager for Sweden who will play a critical role
 

 in scaling the current business. The person we are looking for is a motivated
 

 , self-driven and team-oriented person who will take full ownership of our D2C channel operations. The global team is a tight team where there are unlimited opportunities for growth. 
 




  






 This role includes all aspects of e-commerce, including customer offerings, commercial calendar planning, sales performance, digital platform management, and digital development as well as being responsible for the CRM (e-mail marketing and Loyalty programme).
 




  






 What you will do: 
 



* Responsible for the commercial plan and ensure it is executed and evaluated
* Constantly oversee and implement improvements on the E-com platform to ensure a good customer experience (optimisation of product presentations, check out, reviews etc)
* Work with multiple departments effectively to coordinate promotions, product launches, and inventory.
* Be main point of contact with the performance marketing agency and all of the work they conduct and also be operational counterparty from Under Your Skin and take actions set
* Develop ways of working for weekly, monthly and quarterly analysis of sales and marketing channel performance (incl setting targets)
* Operational and strategic management of the entire e-commerce channel (shopify/klaviyo/google/meta ads), ensuring the store is user-friendly, up-to-date, and conversion-focused
* Assure the brand experience throughout the digital customer journey



  






 Qualifications
 



* 3-5 years of experience with DTC/E-com in a similar role
* Has experience managing platforms such as Shopify
* The ability to enjoy working operationally but still be able to have strong input on the strategic level
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Outgoing, collaborative, and self-driven, always seeking growth opportunities
* Strong analytical skills and data driven approach
* Enthusiasm for being part of a fast-paced, small but growing team in an entrepreneurial setting



  






 With a customer-focused mindset and communication skills and a keen eye for visual appeal, you stay up to date with digital trends. Proactive, self-driven, and collaborative, you're always seeking growth opportunities and possess strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
 




  






 Our office is located in Vasastan, Stockholm. 
 




  






 Interviews take place continuously
 





 Are you interested? Please send resume, personal letter together with a short introduction to you
 

 to
 
 people@underyourskin.se

title: Teamlead
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
PostNord Group AB is a leading provider of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region. The Nordic Support department is responsible for enabling and ensuring the service management in Group function IT. The unit contributes with designing processes, concepts and implementing them in the service management areas to ensure that the processes provide desired business result.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at one of the Nordic region´s largest companies? Are you interested to lead guide and support a team of system administrators and engineers toward achieving specific goals and objective this is the job for you!
   

  

 As a Team Lead in System Operations, you will be responsible for leading a team of system administrators and engineers to ensure the smooth functioning and reliability of the organization's IT infrastructure. Your primary focus will be on managing daily operations, coordinating tasks, and providing technical guidance to team members. You will play a pivotal role in optimizing system performance, implementing best practices, and driving continuous improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of system administrators and engineers offshore.
* Goal Setting: Define team goals, objectives, and priorities aligned with organizational objectives.
* Incident and Problem Management: Lead incident response efforts and conduct root cause analysis for major incidents.
* Change Management: Manage change requests and coordinate system changes, ensuring adherence to processes.
* Performance Monitoring: Implement monitoring tools and analyze system metrics to optimize performance.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations and procedures.
* Knowledge Sharing: Promote knowledge sharing and best practices within the team.


**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* Fundamental knowledge in AWS cloud platform, DevOps, cloud operations
* Jira software, confluence and service management
* Prior experience as team lead in a global organization
* ITIL principles and foundation knowledge
* MS Office


**Meritorious experience:**
* Knowledge in Azure cloud platform
* Team lead experience preferably in a technology or cybersecurity environment


 We believe you are curious and motivated to learn new things - open to opportunities for further training and education. Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage team.
   

  

**We Offer You** 
 :
   

  

* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord´s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus
* Great occupational pension terms
* Great development opportunities


****We make everyday life easier****
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. In this recruitment, PostNord collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75 and Pia Boström pia.bostrom@se.experis.com, +46 70-3146866
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application! The last application date, 2024-10-14
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!

title: IFS Application Consultant
description:
**Join Cegeka’s Growing Project Team** 




  





 As an IFS Application Consultant at Cegeka, you will collaborate closely with our customers to enhance and streamline their business processes through the support of IFS Applications/IFS Cloud. Your expertise will help our clients achieve greater efficiency and innovation in their operations.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Supply chain/Retail: Become a part of Sweden’s leading supply chain consulting team. We develop smart solutions to help our retail customers enhance their business performance.
* Service Management: Improve client service management processes by configuring and customizing IFS modules. Ensure seamless integration and provide user training and support.
* Manufacturing: Streamline production processes for manufacturing clients. Analyze workflows, identify bottlenecks, and implement IFS Applications to boost efficiency and product quality.
* Finance: If you have a background in accounting and IFS finance, we offer you the opportunity to grow and engage in intriguing assignments.
* Development: Develop and customize IFS Applications based on client needs. Ensure successful deployment and integration of tailored solutions.
* Technical: Provide technical support for IFS Applications, including system configurations, performance tuning, and troubleshooting to ensure smooth operations.
* Project Leader: Responsible for overseeing and managing the implementation and execution of IFS ERP projects succesfully.



  





**Cegeka Sweden** 




 Our presence in the Swedish market marks the beginning of an exciting journey where we strive to deliver high-quality services and innovative solutions that help our customers succeed . We are committed to deliver personalized digital services and perfectly aligned with the unique requirements of Swedish business. With the support of our mother company in Belgium, we have access to a broad knowledge base and technical expertise that equips us to meet and exceed our customers' expectations.
 



  





 With a total of 60+ employees and offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Gävle, and Falun, we are able to empower Swedish companies with state-of-the-art IT solutions, helping them overcome challenges and achieve success efficiently. It's possible to work at the office that is most suitable for you and your employment.
 



  





 We have nice offices with an open work environment. We work well in smaller teams and the overall feeling is very family-oriented with close cooperation. We prioritize to enjoy time with our colleagues and gathering different conferences, Summer parties, Christmas parties, activities and after works.
 



  





**About Cegeka Global** 




 Discover Cegeka, a leader driving digital transformation across Europe with 9000+ employees. With a diverse range of cutting-edge digital services and solutions tailored to meet evolving needs of businesses, Cegeka stands at the forefront of innovation. From cloud services to IT consulting, software development to system integration, and infrastructure management, Cegeka offers comprehensive solutions designed to drive businesses forward. Headquarters in Belgium, our reach extends across Europe, bringing our expertise to companies in multiple countries.
 



  





**How To Apply** 




 Send your application to our Business Unit Lead, Joachim Burevik at:
 



  





**Joachim.burevik@cegeka.com** 
 and have
 **Sara.hallkvist@cegeka.com** 
 as a copy (cc) with the title 'IFS Application Consultant'

title: Web Analyst
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**Join Mentimeter as our new Web Analyst**
 We’re looking for a dynamic, experienced and results-driven Web Analyst to join our Stockholm team!
   

  

 You’ll be our in-house expert, responsible for our tech setup and attribution model, while also working closely with our Growth and Data scientist teams to optimize marketing activities and understand user behavior.
   

  

**The Mission**
* Collect and analyze data using web analytics tools like Google Analytics and Mixpanel, in close collaboration with our Data scientist team
* Create reports and dashboards to communicate findings and democratize data for stakeholders using tools such as Looker
* Identify trends and opportunities in website traffic, understanding user behavior and conversion funnels
* Work closely with our website and CRO team to create and validate hypotheses
* Develop and maintain a comprehensive attribution model that accurately tracks the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition and revenue
* Collaborate with other marketing teams to measure the impact of campaigns and content marketing efforts on user acquisition and product adoption
* Ensure the correct tracking of key website events by creating, configuring, and maintaining marketing tags in GTM
* Ensure the correct integration of GA4 with Google Ads, Google Search Console, and other sales and marketing stack
* Improve the synergy between visitor tracking and user data, and support our in-house Marketing analyst – part of the Data team – with revenue/purchases/pipeline analysis
* Responsible for data quality, accurate data collection, and troubleshooting issues, ensuring the correct capture and interpretation of data
* Stay current on industry trends and best practices in web analysis and data visualization


**Who You Are**
* You have at least 3 years of relevant hands-on experience
* You are results-driven and highly analytical
* You’re good at storytelling and can get people inspired with data insights
* You have a proactive and 'can do' attitude with attention to details
* You have experience working with experimentation in a fast-paced environment
* You are experienced with attribution modeling and Web Analytics tools
* A plus if you have experience with customer acquisition cost (CAC) and lifetime value (LTV) analysis in a SaaS or B2B context
* Also a plus if you’re familiar with tools like Mixpanel or paid Analytic tools like Matomo
* Fluent in English with proficient written and verbal communication skills. Swedish is not required as daily work is carried out in English.


**Apply today and join the team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more here about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Introduction interview - Meet TA rep for introduction interview
* Business Case - Conduct a business case showcasing your skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the team in an onsite deep-dive interview
* Culture interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Brand Performance Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**Role background**
 In Wolt, the Central Growth Team is the force driving the entire user funnel from awareness to retention for both new and existing customers as well as our courier partners in our 27 markets. With a strategic mindset, we work to acquire new users as well as make sure our overall funnel is in good shape. Efficiency and incrementality are the key drivers for our marketing decisions.
   

  

 Our 30+ person Performance Marketing Team currently consists of people specialized in User Acquisition, Brand Performance as well as ASO. The people in our team are experts in both digital marketing and analytics, however, we are now at a point where we need a top individual to strengthen the team and focus mainly on growing our business in Central Europe through online marketing channels. The person will directly report to the Global Brand Performance Lead.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Responsible for online branding campaigns in a set of countries and owning planning and execution there.
* Design, manage, implement, and execute online branding strategies.
* Implement, manage, and optimize marketing campaigns on both Web & Mobile across Facebook, Google, Paid Social, Ad Networks as well as Programmatic.
* Work closely with other members of the Marketing team across all Wolt regions.
* Work with a data-driven way to do and measure online branding as well as clear KPIs such as CTR, VCR, BSI, and install uplift.
* Continuous improvement of our performance, processes, and workflows by challenging the status quo, both in terms of quality and efficiency (e.g. campaign set-up, media buying, A/B testing, reporting).
* Analyze data to monitor performance, and traffic quality and identify marketing growth opportunities.
* Manage stakeholder interests and provide ongoing feedback/reporting analysis.
* Identify top-performing partners and channels and build strong relationships.
* Implement, Identify & Troubleshoot attribution/tracking issues.


**Our humble expectations**
* Proven track record in Web & Mobile media buying.
* You have a background in the gaming/tech/app/mobile industry and specific experience in some subset of Paid Social, Google & Programmatic.
* Extensive hands-on experience with paid online marketing (either on Ad Manager or FMP), managing & scaling your own budget, in the mobile or E-commerce industry.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively plan media investments based on both business and campaign level KPIs, manage and optimize budget across channels, and do in-house media buying.
* In-depth knowledge and solid experience with web, mobile tracking and analytics.
* Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects.
* Analytical mindset; Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets (e.g vlookup, pivot, etc.) or experience with data analytics.
* A proactive, passionate, and organized self-starter, who doesn’t accept the status quo, but always seeks to improve and automate processes and workflows in order to increase performance.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, and other languages are a plus.


**Next Steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan.
   

  

 You will fit into a truly diverse team across 27 countries - what really matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity. Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring, is on our daily agenda.
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications sent by mail** 
 . You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

**About Wolt**
*Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt works together with over 55,000 restaurant and retail partners as well as with over 125,000 courier partners across 23 countries and more than 200 cities.*
*We’ve also been fortunate enough to receive some appreciation and recognition for our hard work along the way: Apple selected Wolt’s app as their Editors’ Choice, Wired named the company one of the “Hottest Startups in Europe,” Forbes included our CEO Miki Kuusi on its 30-under-30 in Consumer Tech list, and the Nordic Startup Awards named Wolt Company of the Year.*
*In 2020, the Financial Times named us Europe’s second fastest growing company. We’re still expanding rapidly and are looking for more talented individuals to join us. If you are passionate about cutting-edge technology, great food, and making an impact in your city, then Wolt just might be for you.
   

  

 Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of seconds, in the customer’s own language. We’ve raised more than €707M in financing from renowned U.S. and European based investors, such as ICONIQ Capital, Tiger Global, DST, Prosus, KKR, Coatue, 83North, Goldman Sachs, Highland Europe and EQT Ventures & EQT Growth, among others.*

description:

 I rollen ingår bland annat att:

**Vi erbjuder**

Vi tror också att utveckling skapas genom att lösa utmanande uppgifter i spännande uppdrag tillsammans med kollegor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter.

**Låter det som något för dig?**
 B3 Financial Consulting är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande konsultföretag inom IT och management. B3 Consulting Group har blivit utnämnt till Årets Karriärbolag 2022 och vi vill fortsätta att växa, så ansök till oss idag och följ med på vår resa!
   

  

 Vi kommer att intervjua kandidater löpande och ber dig därför att ansöka redan idag.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på B3 och hur vi arbetar med vår wellness och våra sociala initiativ här.

title: Sales Executive B2B
description:
Are you a passionate salesperson with a strong ability to build relationships and drive business? Do you want to be part of a high paced team where you can make an impact and develop our customers wellbeing? Then we have the perfect position for you!
 



  





 Bruce Studios started back in 2015 with the goal to shake and change the fitness industry at the core. Since then we have been on the mission to develop the #1 training app in the world, with the vision to offer full access to all studios and the best training on the market.
 



  





 From a cultural perspective, it’s all about trust, giving your best effort, and treating others with respect. At Bruce Studios, there is no room for prestige; the best idea always wins.
 



  





 In order to achieve our ambitious plans we are currently looking for a talented B2B Sales Executive to join our team. You’ll play an important role in a small team and you’ll report to our Head of B2B. Every coworker is carefully selected to best fit the team, and we all carry a great portion of attentiveness, true instinct and talent.
 



  





 YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
 



 As a B2B Sales Executive, you will:
 



  




* Map, contact, and drive sales with potential B2B customers
* Ensure a smooth onboarding process for newly acquired customers
* Follow up with customers and report feedback to Head of B2B
* Identify B2B development areas and drive resolutions
* Track and report market and competitor activities
* Report monthly to Head of B2B



  





 YOUR PROFILE
 



 We are looking for someone who:
 



  




* Has a proven track record in B2B sales, preferably within SMEs and/or the same industry as Bruce Studios
* Is relationship-oriented and capable of creating long-term partnerships, both internally and externally
* Has excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Has a results-driven mindset with focus on achieving and exceeding sales targets
* Is fluent in English and Swedish, a plus if you also speak Danish or Norwegian
* Demonstrates grit and resilience, thriving in high-pressure situations and persisting through challenges to deliver exceptional results
* Has problem-solving skills with the ability to identify challenges and propose effective solutions for clients
* Has capacity to analyze customer needs and sales data for strategy improvement
* Possess strong organizational skills to manage multiple clients and tasks efficiently



  





 WHAT WE OFFER
 


* Being an important part of a purpose driven, rapidly growing organization passionate about creating happier and healthier people
* A high paced environment where you will be able to contribute and make an impact
* Fixed monthly salary + variable compensation based on performance
* 30 days vacation
* Pension benefits
* Ability to work remote part-time
* A Bruce Studios Epic membership



  





 APPLICATION
 



 Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Send your application and CV by 2024-10-31.
 
 As diversity is something that is important to us we’d love to see applicants from all gender identities, ages, cultural backgrounds and physical abilities.
