title: Technical Writer
description:
Join Xylem in the global mission to #LetsSolveWater! As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

**Technical Writer**
 As a technical writer at Xylem, you will develop customer-centric product information for a wide range of cutting-edge water technology products such as wastewater and drainage pumps, mixers for treatment plants, and monitoring and control devices for pumping stations. The product information is developed in English and in close cooperation with several functions within R&D and product management.
   

  

 The position is based in Sundbyberg, Sweden, and you will be part of an open, inclusive, and positive team of 6 technical writers. The Swedish team is part of the global technical communications team with members in India, USA, Germany, and Italy. The global team is a team of cross-border technical information experts who are dedicated to create simplicity out of complexity and to provide customers with quality results through intelligent content reuse (using XML technologies and/or Markdown). The content strategy is to single-source Xylem's information content and to make it available globally in a reusable form. The development of the content is governed by common processes, tools, and controls for multiple publication outputs to multiple channels in multiple languages.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Independently plan and develop content for reuse and reusability in accordance with the product risk analyses, subject matter expertise, and internal content development guidelines
+ Analyze existing content
+ Understand illustrations and their role in the documentation
+ Perform software-assisted quality review of style, grammar, and terminology during the content development phase
+ Perform peer review on markup and content
+ Organize SME review to ensure technical accuracy
+ Deliver on time

* Contribute to the development of the content management system and internal guidelines through collaborations in the global technical communications team


**Personal characteristics**
 As a technical writer, it is important that you can search and find the relevant information that is needed to create the product information. Therefore, you must be communicative and able to critically analyze and question information. The development of the product information is a cooperation between you and several stakeholders, and it is important that you are patient, open, flexible, and meticulous. A good cooperation also requires you to take your responsibility in the process and to be professional and speak up when needed.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* A degree in engineering or relevant technical work experience
* Excellent English grammar and writing skills
* Good enough English oral skills to comfortably discuss work and technology related issues in English
* Experience and understanding of single sourcing of content in DITA XML and Component Content Management Systems (CCMS)
* Understanding or knowledge of foreign languages and basic illustration skills are advantageous


 Applicants are required to take a writing test to convey their content structuring abilities and technical English language skills.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of diversity, equity and inclusion in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: Helpdeskmedarbetare till statlig myndighet!
description:
Är du teknikintresserad och brinner för att ge förstklassig support? Vi söker engagerade IT-konsulter som är skickliga på att lösa tekniska problem och säkerställa att användare får en smidig upplevelse med sin IT-utrustning.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, initialt under 4 månader, med god chans till förlängning
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* felsöka och säkerställa att användarnära IT-utrustning fungerar
  
* tillhandahålla supportstöd via t.ex. telefon, e-post och på plats mot användare avseende hård- och mjukvara
  
* administration t.ex. användarkonton och behörigheter
  
* vägleda användare i olika program
  
* arbeta med ärenden i ärendehanteringssystem Nilex
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* någon eftergymnasial utbildning eller annan likvärdig IT-utbildning och minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande arbete.
  
* goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av bärbara datorer och kringutrustning, Windows 11, Apple iOS-enheter (iPads och mobiler), förståelse för informationssäkerhet
  
* goda kunskaper av att ge support i MS Office 2016 eller senare
  
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med ärendehanteringssystem
  
* kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska, såväl i tal som skrift, då språket används i det dagliga arbetet
  
* erfarenhet av att ge support via telefon och mail
  
* erfarenhet av att testa och felsöka hård- och mjukvara för klientdatorer
  
* erfarenhet av kontohantering, lösenord och on-/offboarding
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* grundkunskaper om MDM/EMM-system
  
* erfarenhet av videokonferenssystem
  
* erfarenhet att beställa hårdvara
  
* erfarenhet av att skapa lathundar och dokumentation
  
* erfarenhet av abonnemangsfrågor (beställning, avslut, felsökning)
  
* erfarenhet av arbetsgången under en driftstörning avseende ärendehantering och samordning
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* en god kommunikativ förmåga
  
* vara trygg i sin roll, ha en god känsla för service och support
  
* vara noggrann och vill ha ordning och reda
  
* arbeta strukturerat och ha förmåga att hantera flera arbetsuppgifter parallellt
  
* van att ta eget ansvar och driva sitt arbete självständigt framåt
  
* är bekväm att jobba i grupp
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Fanny Steisjö eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107679

title: Business Developer to AAX Biotech
description:
AAX Biotech AB is a research-driven biotech company specialized in overcoming challenges in the development of next-generation antibody therapeutics. Founded by leading experts from Karolinska Institutet, we are committed to driving innovation through our proprietary technologies, Seqitope™ and Opti-mAb™. With a mission to solve technical hurdles in drug development, we aim to be a trusted partner for pharmaceutical companies worldwide.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are a start-up and need your contribution to make the world aware of our technologies. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of a rapidly growing market and play a key role in expanding our customer base. Your main responsibility will be to promote our Seqitope™ technology and build strategic partnerships with pharma companies. We promise you a lot of responsibility, a work culture built on trust and the attitude that we try, re-try, adapt and try again. It will be an exciting journey!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* New Customer Acquisition: Identify and engage potential customers, focusing on promoting Seqitope™. Conduct presentations, negotiations, and close deals.
* Sales Strategy & Marketing Activities: Collaborate with the CEO in developing and implementing sales strategies. Continuously analyse market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape. As well as contribution in the development of marketing campaigns and promotional activities
* Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain relationships with key partners and customers. Ensure customer satisfaction and use feedback to enhance service offerings.


 This position is based in Stockholm and we are located at A Working Lab in Solna Campus. In this position you are expected to travel, mainly within Europe but also North America. We foresee participation in approximately 5-7 conferences per year.
   

  

 Your profil
   

  

 To succeed in this role a scientific understanding is essential. You need to understand the technology and our customers’ everyday challenges. We are a small team, so this is an opportunity to take responsibility and show leadership. You will not be alone, we are a team, but to survive and flourish in our environment self-management and an agile approach is a key.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

* MSc or Phd in Molecular biology, Immunology, Medical science or equivalent.
* A proven track record in sales and business development is meritorious, ideally within the biotech or pharmaceutical industry.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trusting relationships.
* Ambitious, driven, and ready to make a significant impact.
* Ability to travel (we estimate that you will participant in around 5-7 conferences per year mainly in Europe but also in North America).


 Application
   

  

 In this recruitment AAX Biotech is collaborating with SallyQ. If you are interested in the position please send in your application or reach out to Sandra for further information.
   

  

 Sandra Bydell Sveder, Recruitment Consultant, 0763199688,
 **sandra.sveder@sallyq.se** 
 . We accept applications until the 3rd of November.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Proxify is Europe’s largest network of deeply vetted software engineers. We drive tech success by bridging the talent gap. Our mission is to connect the world’s best developers with the opportunities they deserve. We partner with more than 2000 companies in 30 different countries, ranging from SaaS startups, Fintech, and Deeptech companies within AI to established enterprises within Media, Electronics, and Finance.
 



  





**Are you a true relationship builder with a strong understanding of sales, technology, people, and business? Do you have tech skills and a solid background in sales?** 




  





 We're on the lookout for a high-performing, yet humble
 
 Customer Success Manager with a strong tech background and interest to play a pivotal role in our rapid expansion within the Nordic market. As one of Europe's fastest-growing companies in the industry, expanding in the Nordics remains a key strategic goal.
 



  





 As part of the Client Management team, you’ll be responsible for growing our client partnerships as well as initiating long-term collaborations between clients and developers. As our future
 **Customer Success Manager (Technical)** 
 , you’ll focus on the Nordic countries where the demand for skilled developers is growing.
 



  





**What your week will look like:** 




  




* Lead initial client ‘Intro’ meetings to gain an in-depth understanding of their business and development needs, effectively pitch Proxify, and secure the next steps to matching them with their next developer.
* Drive deals through the sales funnel once qualified - ensuring speed and quality.
* Work closely with the Client Engineering team to carefully match the opportunity with the right developer, ensuring their skills and experience are the right fit for client requirements.
* Close deals, onboard clients and nurture strong client relationships.
* Continuously contribute to improving our ways of working and increase efficiency and success as we grow and evolve.
* Directly impact the growth and success of Proxify Inc and its clients by matching them with exceptional candidates and establishing long-term partnerships.



  





**Why you’ll love this opportunity at Proxify:** 




  





 🌐 Get the possibility to solve most tech teams’ biggest challenge - bridging their competence gap - and at the same time offer great opportunities to developers around the world
 



 ❤️ Join a team of tech lovers where support and humility are our guiding principles
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships in the Nordic countries
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international environment where we from time to time meet and spend quality time together (our team spanning 39 countries!)
 



  





**To be successful in this role, we believe that you:** 




  




* Have hands-on experience with technology, such as working as a technical project manager, product manager, developer, or a similar role, ideally within a tech team
* Have an intrinsic sense of urgency, responsibility and ownership
* Are passionate about closing the competence gap in tech
* Possess a curiosity about technological innovations and trends, continually seeking to understand how they can be leveraged to solve real-world problems and improve efficiency
* Understand how to help a client and guiding them through the customer journey
* Are not just a talker; you make things happen and pay keen attention to details!



  





**Why it may not be your match:** 




  





 ❌ You like everyday to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep agile
 



 ❌ You don't have any technical experience
 



 ❌ You don’t speak Swedish on a native level
 



  





 At Proxify, we believe that together, we can achieve our dreams. Anything is possible, with the right people. Are you in?
 



  





 Be our guest and visit our website to learn more about us. Can’t wait to meet you! 🚀
 



  





*Kindly submit your application/CV in English - our standardized language used at Proxify.*

title: Customer Excellence Agent
description:
Is Customer Excellence only a job where you answer the phone?
 



  





 Heck no! We value our Customer Excellence team very highly as they are the pros of all products we offer and all user feedback that we get. We want to be approachable and easy to get in touch with. That’s why we’re always on the lookout for more user-friendly ways of communicating over chat, phone, or email. The journey only starts with Customer Excellence, but they’re also the ones who make our users stay for the full adventure.
 



  





 At
 **Lunar** 
 we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay and invest. We have grown by leaps and bounds since starting out in Aarhus in 2015 and are now considered a
 **major player** 
 in the Nordics with offices in Aarhus, Copenhagen and Stockholm as well as employees working remotely across Europe.
 



  





 As we continue to scale our impact, we are looking for a
 **Customer Excellence Agent** 
 to help ensure and maintain the high quality and level of service that we want to deliver.
 



 As our new
 **Customer Excellence Agent** 
 you will be part of our Customer Excellence team. The team currently consists of more than 100 amazing individuals working across Denmark, Sweden, and Norway — all of them focused on ensuring that our users love using Lunar — every day. To us, being Customer Obsessed is more than just a buzzword. It’s a way of working.
 



  





 We welcome all to apply to this exciting and impactful role and look forward to following up with candidates who we believe are the best potential fit based on the following criteria:
 


* You have worked with service and sales for at least 1 years
* You're fluent in Swedish and English - bonus if you speak fluent Norweigan
* You know how to provide excellent service — and take pride in doing so
* You can keep an overview in an ever-changing environment
* You thrive on feedback and understand the importance of both giving and receiving it
* You are a problem solver and love finding solutions



  





 If this is you, please read on to learn more and consider applying. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 What will you do?
 


* Handle inquiries from our valued customers — both written and over the phone
* Use your knowledge to assess what the individual user needs — and ensure they get it
* Help improve and optimize processes and products by providing your feedback and ideas
* Help the team to reach and improve own and common goals for service level and efficiency
* Take part in building a bank with awesome and talented people



  





 Nice to know
 



 📍The job is located in Stockholm
 



 🕰 40-hour workweek
 



 🗓 Your shifts will be between 8.00-16.30 every weekday
 



  





 We’re looking forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 Check out Lunar’s
 **careers page** 
 for information on benefits and our interview process.
 



 Curious to know what else we’re up to? Check out our
 **LinkedIn** 
 ,
 **Instagram** 
 , and
 **blog** 
 for the latest and greatest!
 



  





**Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.**

title: Senior Officer for Operational and Data Risk Testing - Controls Management
description:
*Would you like to embark on a journey becoming trusted advisor towards the business, as well as ensuring an environment that supports a strong risk culture? This role might be suitable for you!* 




 We are looking for a Senior Risk officer, who will contribute to delivering on a robust testing framework within Operational and Data Risk. It is a great opportunity to take an active part in supporting further development of the Controls Management unit.
 



 The Business Controls and Product Management (BCPM) department plays a central part in supporting the Business in achieving its strategic goals with reporting lines to the heads of the three business units: Large Corporates & Institutions, Business Customers and Personal Customers.
 



 Controls Management is an independent 1st LoD (Line of Defence) control testing unit within BCPM, separate from the control ownership and operation in the business units, with the aim to ensure that controls are designed and operated effectively.
 



  





**Managing testing for Operational and Data Risk across all Business Unit** 




 sAs a member of the Operational and Data Risk team, you will work closely with colleagues within BCPM at all levels as well as key stakeholders from 1st, 2nd and 3rd LoD
 



 .Your key responsibilities will primarily consist of
 


* :Developing and implementing comprehensive control testing for Operational and Data Risks incl. test scripts for key controls, test frequency among others
* .Analyzing and interpreting test results to highlight areas of strengths and improvement for Operational and Data Risks across Business areas
* .Identifying opportunities for test automation for key controls
* .Collaborating with the teams across Controls management in the Nordics and Lithuania
* .Supporting escalation of test results and monitoring for Senior management and Governing Risk Committees



  





**.
   

 Bring a collaborative and self-motivated mind-s** 




 etWe imagine you are a structured and pragmatic person, having the ability to get things done – in collaboration with other team members as well as key stakeholders. We value collaboration, knowledge sharing, and timely execution, to ensure our team can perform at its bes
 



 t.As our organization is moving at a fast pace, it is important that you show flexibility and initiative in a fast-changing environmen
 



 t.We are looking for an experienced candidate who ha
 


* s:Minimum 4 years of non-financial risk management experience, ideally with particular emphasis on Operational risks and/or Data Ris
* k.Knowledge of financial products and processes, with practical ability to combine risk management principles with the needs of the busines
* s.The ability to look beyond the numbers and identify the underlying risk drivers and trend
* s.Advanced written communication skills to convey complex findings in a short and easily understandable manne
* r.Solid experience working with stakeholders across organizational line
* s.Fluency in spoken and written English is required; knowledge of any Nordic language is beneficia



  





**l.What we off** 




 erThis role can be situated in either Poland, Lithuania, Denmark, Sweden, Norway or Finlan
 



 d.If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3360-5040 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job). Your title will be Officer - Business Risk and Controls, Senio
 



 r.It is important for us to ensure our employees keep proper work-life balance and stay motivated, therefore we offer you a rich and comprehensive benefits packag
 



 e.We care about well-being, as well as keeping up the team spirit and creating a positive, nurturing atmosphere in the office. Therefore, while work from home is allowed, physical presence in the office is expected at least 3 days per week, letting us stay connected and integrate
 



  





  





**d!
   

  

 Does that sound interest** 




 ing?If you would like to support us in managing risks and controls, then you should ap
 



 ply!If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Head of Operational and Data Risk, Jessica Newman, on Linke
 



 dIn.Please appl
 
 y in Eng
 
 lish as soon as possible as we will conduct interviews on an ongoing ba
 


 sis.

title: Financial Controller
description:
**Working at Mercell**
 At Mercell, we're on a mission to revolutionize public procurement, making it accessible and effortless for everyone involved. Imagine a world where public buyers and visionary suppliers come together seamlessly to make a great deal easier and shape the future. That's what we're all about.
   

  

 With a dynamic culture built on continuous growth, trust, and collaboration, Mercell offers an environment where your talents can thrive. You will be part of an international environment with ambitious and dedicated colleagues who are passionate about what they do and supported to be themselves.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 We are now hiring a Financial controller for mainly our companies in Finland, who will be part of Mercell's Finance Shared Service Center's team, located in our newly renovated office in the Center of Stockholm. As our new Financial controller, you will have an important, exciting and impactful role where you will be participating in improving and streamlining our financial processes together with the team.
   

  

 We see the following qualities as important to thrive and evolve in this role:
   

  

* Knowledgeable, and accountable
* Ability to keep calm and be tolerant to high pressure and tight deadlines
* Curious and enjoy change


**Core Responsibilities:**
* Monthly closing, controlling and reporting procedures for a portfolio of legal entities, but specialized for Finland.
* Booking of salaries and salary related costs, VAT, GL journals and other items. Also, controlling of salary and salary related items and follow up on external contractors. Reporting of social security and personnel tax
* Controlling and reporting of VAT, tax and similar, in addition to the responsibility for preparing complete audit documentation.
* Internal control procedures such as balance sheet reconciliations, analysis of P&L, Balance sheet and Cash flow items with purpose to ensure accuracy and completeness in financial accounting
* Prepare Corporate income tax returns and coordinate with external contractors and Head of Accounting and controlling
* Prepare Annual statement and coordinate with Head of Accounting and Controlling and with Auditors
* Participate in relevant projects related to improvements / development of finance processes together with the Finance team and the System and Process specialist.


**Required Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree within Finance, Accounting or Auditing. Relevant and extended experience can compensate for formal education
* Preferably 3-5 years relevant experience as Financial controller or similar position in complex environments.
* In- depth knowledge of accounting principles, tax and VAT, for Finland. If you have knowledge from other European countries, it will be an advantage.
* Experience from internal and external financial reporting, and knowledge of good practices of internal controls over financial reporting
* Advanced user of IT systems (ERP, Excel, Financial reporting tools)
* Fluent in English and Finnish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Fluency in one of the Scandinavian languages
* Experience of using Netsuite


**Start date:** 
 January 2025
   

  

**Duration** 
 : Full time permanent role
   

  

**Workplace type:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden, Stockholm
   

  

**Application Deadline: 30.10.2024.** 
 However, do not wait to submit your application - we will read applications and talk to potential candidates as we receive them.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As a growing technology company, we are committed to taking care of our employees through initiatives such as hybrid work to support your work-life balance, health and insurance plans (may differ per country/office), pension plans, paid parental leave, social happenings and competitive salary packages. Please see https://career.mercell.com/post/our-perks-benefits to get more insights on what to expect of perks, benefits and culture when joining Mercell.
   

  

**Has this sparked your interest?**
 Then we can't wait to have you join our mission and look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions for this position, we are happy to chat with you. Please reach out to Hiring Manager: Annika Larsson, Head of Accounting/Financial Control
   

  

 Email: Annika.larsson@commerce.com
   

  

*We may carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant. Current applicants will receive further information about this.*

title: Product Owner - Identity and Access Management  (IAM)
description:
**Job ID: 26217** 


  
 





 Would you like to have a key role in Protecting the Bank by contributing to the development of our IAM solutions at Nordea? We are now looking for a Product Owner to our IAM Onboarding team to help drive our application onboarding agenda and together with the team develop automated process for the future.
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 At Identity and access management (IAM) we provide centralised and standardised Identity and Access Management services and act as single point of contact for all units within Nordea acquiring these services. IAM belongs to the Cyber Security area within Nordea.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Product Owner to join our IAM Onboarding team. The team consists of one Scrum Master and several Subject Matters Expert focusing on application onboarding to IAM controls, mainly in the IdentityIQ system.
 





  

  



**What you will be doing** 






  

  



 As a Product Owner you will be responsible for our Onboarding related deliveries. You will play an important role in collaborating with our stakeholders, supporting our IAM teams and driving the improvement work around our services.
 





  
 





 You will:
 




* Have close dialog with Stakeholders (internal) to form a good understanding of the business needs within Nordea for this area.
* Together with IAM Architects, Management and other Product Owners prioritize and plan our deliveries.
* Set clear directions and prioritization for the team.
* Collaborate with the Scrum Master and the team to support them throughout sprints planning.
* Work with continues development and improvements of our services.
* Be the link between IAM and Stakeholders and support the team by clarifying and translating requirements.
* Act as a deputy for the Head of IAM Onboarding when needed.



  
 





 The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, Helsinki, Finland, Gdynia, Poland or Oslo, Norway.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – qualities we look forward to share with you.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 
 You are used to working independently with high level of responsibility and are comfortable in decision making. You have experience from understanding and translating stakeholder needs and requirements and have great analytical skills where you can bring theory into practical usage. You have strong driving force and a structured way of working. An ability to utilize excellent communication skills on many organizational levels will be of great use. You also have strong facilitation and problem-solving skills.
   

  

**Your experience and background:** 





* Experience in a Product Owner, Project Manager or a stakeholder management role.
* Experience in IT and preferably Identity Access Management disciplines.
* Previous experience working with Agile methodology.
* Fluency in both written and spoken English.
* Your educational background is master’s or bachelor’s degree, or equivalent.



  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 13/10/2024
 



 . Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Sona Celik.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 







 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 







**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
  Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Facility Manager Sweden
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*Step into an exciting role in Danske Bank's Facility Management, where you drive the local strategy directly shaping the workday experiences and blends operational projects and service delivery management.*
**Facility Manager for Danske Bank Stockholm leading our Workplace services of tomorrow and creating unique user experience and high customer satisfaction.**
 Danske Bank’s Facility Management’s purpose is to ensure the functionality and efficiency of our current offices and at the same time play a key role in shaping the future workplaces. This ranges from covering the service experience at the office over digital tools to execution of operational projects. The objective is to weave the services into great experiences, providing employees with a seamless workday and our visitors with a great experience.
   

  

 We are organised in a matrix organisation with a Facility Manager in all the Nordic countries and Lithuania and subject matter experts in soft and hard facility management. Therefore, alignment between the units is essential to ensure a coherent service experience across the Danske Bank Group.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will be responsible for the service delivery across our facilities in Sweden hosting some 1,500 colleagues. Areas of responsibility include Catering & Cleaning Services, Office Support, Technical Maintenance and execution of minor projects. Your innovative mindset and forward-thinking approach will bring inspiration to Danske Bank. This will make way for building the workplaces of tomorrow and influencing the development and improvement of our service standards. You will be instrumental in driving the innovative transformation of our workplaces locally.
   

  

 You will also drive the user experience and stakeholder engagement, and it follows that you are comfortable navigating a large organisation. You manage budgets in Sweden in accordance with the facility management strategy both in terms of the service and project costs.
   

  

 The work includes:
   

  

* Develop and drive the strategic and tactical planning of facility management activities locally, including the digital roadmap for the Facility Management domain
* Leverage partners to drive the service experience at the workplace fuelling the user experience
* Managing the Facility Management budget and the ongoing spend, including monthly performance reporting and governance
* Monitoring service deliveries to ensure quality and safety standards
* Close collaboration with different stakeholders like business leads, service partners, and contractors
* Handling queries, complaints, and escalation issues to ensure solutions from the service partner
* Managing different responsibilities and tight schedules won’t be a problem because you have a structured approach and communication skills for efficient collaboration


**About You**
*“To succeed in this role, you can translate feedback from customers and end-users into positive service experiences,”* 
 says Christian Lau Jensen, Head of Group Facility Management.
   

  

 You also have the following qualifications:
   

  

* 3-5 years of work experience within Facility Management, particularly with driving high end-user satisfaction through outsourcing partners
* A bachelor's degree in Facility Management, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field
* Strong skills in stakeholder and operations management
* Skilled in budgeting and accounting
* User experience of MS Office tools and property management software
* Proficiency in English and Swedish


**Our offering**
*“You will join an inspiring team aiming to be at the forefront of Facility Management - providing the Bank’s employees, customers, and the public with a unique experience when visiting Danske Bank. Although we work independently in different countries, we take care of team spirit and support each other by actively communicating and sharing coffee moments together* 
 ”, says Christian, your upcoming leader.
   

  

 On top of that, Danske Bank can offer you different development and learning opportunities, a chance to work flexibly in an international setting, and valuable employee benefits to support your wellbeing.
   

  

 Learn more about Danske Bank as an employer: www.danskebank.com/careers .
   

  

**Take the next step and apply**
 We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so you can apply right away! Please send your CV and cover letter in English by 31.10.2024 at the latest.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to
 **Christian Lau Jensen** 
 , Head of Group Facility Management, at CJENS@danskebank.dk.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Senior Strategic Account Manager, Scandinavia (Fulltime consultant / contractor)
description:
The LYCRA Company has built a leading position in the Apparel industry over the years via a continuous stream of value-adding fiber, fabric or garment innovations enabled and supported by a network of strategic partners across the entire value chain. This contributed to make the LYCRA® brand a unique asset that still powers today one of the most iconic and valuable corporate franchises in the Apparel industry. It is all reflected in our corporate vision: “enhancing life through innovative garment solutions”.
 



  





**Responsibilities**



* Manage LYCRA®’s business with workwear and sportswear brands and retailers in Scandinavian countries, generating fiber specification across the segment for the specific account in the region.
* Create and challenge business development strategies by understanding profitability of the business, identifying growth opportunities at downstream customers, and creating marketing and sales programs, which are valuable to the business.
* Identify growth opportunities across the specific segment.
* Create local market strategies to grow the LYCRA®, LYCRA® T400®, COOLMAX® and THERMOLITE® business.
* Understand retailer/brand/packager business strategies, objectives, value chain and incentives to create programs they will value.
* Maximize ROI with advertising and promotion investments.
* Find profitable commercial opportunities with retailers/ brands.
* Create marketing programs, digital, instore and/or packaging.
* Be able to track and manage complex business growth expectations and sales opportunities.
* Be a leader in innovative products and marketing; suggest programs for the business, long and short term, which drive relevance, excitement, and growth.
* Function as a link between Sales, Technical, and the Marketing teams to provide market feedback on trends, new product development ideas and marketing platforms.
* Manage Intellectual Property including trade and wordmarks.
* Perform all of the above, while ensuring the highest level of ethics and 100% compliance with all applicable laws.



  





**Essential Requirements**



* Degree in marketing, product development, business or equivalent at 2:1 or above.
* Strong knowledge of the workwear / sportswear segments: key players, needs, requirements, regulations.
* Proven economic thinking and problem-solving skills.
* In-depth experience with financial and data analysis.
* Ability to manage multiple business priorities simultaneously.
* Experience with managing spreadsheets and profitability models.
* Ability to manage advertisement and promotion campaigns and deliver within proposed budget.
* Previous experience / background at a retailer or brand (preferably apparel).
* Effective verbal and written communications within all levels of the business.
* Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment and across all functions and levels of an organization.
* Fluency (written and spoken) in English.
* Located in Scandinavian country with appropriate right to work.
* Flexibility to travel within Europe and attend meetings in other regions, as required.



  





**Desirable requirements**



* Knowledge of the textile value chain and ingredient branding would be beneficial.
* Proficiency in any other European languages.



  





 With your application you agree that your information will be recorded in our files (up to 6 months after finalizing the position) and if necessary, forwarded to affiliated companies.
 



  





 The LYCRA Company innovates and produces fiber and technology solutions for the apparel and personal care industries. Headquartered in Wilmington, Delaware, The LYCRA Company is recognized worldwide for its innovative products, technical expertise, sustainable solutions, and unmatched marketing support. The LYCRA Company owns leading consumer and trade brands: LYCRA®, LYCRA HyFit®, LYCRA® T400®, COOLMAX®, THERMOLITE®, ELASPAN®, SUPPLEX®, and TACTEL®. The LYCRA Company’s legacy stretches back to 1958 with the invention of the original spandex yarn, LYCRA® fiber. Today, The LYCRA Company focuses on adding value to its customers’ products by developing unique innovations designed to meet the consumer’s need for comfort and lasting performance. For more information, visit www.thelycracompany.com
 



  





 As a principled-based organization, The LYCRA Company is committed to a fair, respectful, and equitable workplace that embraces diversity and reflects the communities in which it operates. This helps foster an environment where employees feel valued, fulfilled, and able to achieve their full potential. Furthermore, we believe that a diverse workforce operating in such an environment is central to our success, as we need not only the right skill sets but also a wide breadth of perspectives and ideas, diverse life experiences, & a seamless collaboration between employees to achieve our company purpose of “enhancing life through innovative garment solutions”.

title: Lösningsarkitekt med inriktning på informationssystem
description:
**Är du lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet av att arbeta med informationssystem? Vill du arbeta i internationella arbetsgrupper? Är du analytisk och resultatorienterad? Vill du arbeta i kvalificerade projekt med syfte att bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi söker.**
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som lösningsarkitekt med inriktning på informationssystem kommer du att delta i arbetet med implementering av Federated Mission Networking (FMN,) ramverket till informationssystem. Du arbetar med att realisera detta arkitekturramverk till att driftsatta system för att skapa materielförmåga till stöd för ledning till det svenska försvaret. Du kommer tillsammans med andra kompetenser och roller främst inom FMV och industrin att leda och inrikta utvecklingen av de informationssystem som följer eller i framtiden kommer att följa FMN-ramverket. Du får en viktig nyckelroll och arbetar i ett stort projektteam med många andra engagerade specialister. Rollen innebär både stor frihetsgrad, stort ansvar och möjlighet att påverka. Här får du verkligen vara arkitekt!
   

  

 Systemfloran är mycket komplex och du kommer får arbeta inom IT-arkitektur, system av system, system i samverkan samt system i fokus inklusive systemintegration. I rollen arbetar du med informationshantering, informationssäkerhet och informationsarkitektur. Du förväntas utveckla och samordna verksamheten i nära dialog med andra på olika nivåer inom både FMV, Försvarsmakten, internationella arbetsgrupper/NATO samt industrin med fokus på att skapa ökad materielförmåga för Försvarsmakten.
   

  

 Tjänsteresor förekommer, såväl inrikes som utrikes. Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Du har en civil/högskoleingenjörs eller systemvetenskaplig utbildning, alternativt har förvärvat motsvarande kompetens på annat sätt. Du har god arbetslivserfarenhet inom det tekniska området IT-arkitektur. Du har flerårig erfarenhet av kravställning, design och utveckling enligt några vedertagna ramverk. Utveckling och förvaltning av informationssystem samt integration till kompletta och användbara informationssystem är också något du ska ha relevant och aktuell erfarenhet av. Du har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska. Det är meriterande om du har en certifiering inom Enterprisearkitektur.
   

  

 Du har god samarbetsförmåga och tycker om att arbeta i grupp. Du är analytisk och arbetar väl med komplexa frågor och löser komplicerade problem väl. Arbetar du mot gemensamt uppsatta mål och fokuserar på resultat har du lättare att lyckas i rollen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Som myndighet i försvarssektorn är vårt uppdrag att leverera det som vårt svenska försvar behöver, viktigare än någonsin. Som en del av avdelningen Informationssystem inom vårt verksamhetsområde Ledningssystemmateriel är du en viktig person i utvecklingen och upphandlingen av säkra system till försvaret. Vi letar efter dig som tillsammans med avdelningens medarbetare och våra samarbetspartners vill utveckla, vidareutveckla och upphandla system och produkter som bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt.
   

  

 På FMV jobbar vi aktivt utifrån utvecklande medarbetarskap, som är en modell för att utveckla samarbete, främja ansvarstagande och skapa engagemang för att ta tillvara på den initiativförmåga som vi alla besitter. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?**
 Sök tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO Kari Lehto, OFR/S Micael Festin, OFR/O Lars Carlsson, och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås på telefon 08-782 4000 (FMV Växel).
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten ber vi dig kontakta Petter Winther på telefon 08-782 4000.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta rekryterare Eva Tärnström, e-post: eva.tarnstrom@fmv.se.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-10-31.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan.**
 FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. Som medarbetare hos oss får du både en trygg och utmanande anställning och ett stort eget ansvar. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: MarTech lead to ICA Banken
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
*ICA Banken are on a journey to establish an omnichannel customer journey and we are therefore investing in our marketing automation platform. We are now looking for a dedicated MarTech (Marketing Technology) lead to drive this establishment.* 
  

  

  

  

**This is your job:** 
  

  

 Welcome to a high-performing technical team that will have a fundamental impact on ICA Banken’s journey to establish omnichannel customer journeys. As MarTech lead you will have responsibility for the strategy and vision of the MarTech stack. The primary scope of this role is on CRM however, in the roadmap to enable an omnichannel customer journey in the future this scope will expand and include the entire customer experience in digital platforms. The MarTech team consists of two marketing automation specialists, one solution architect and additional support from other teams.
   

  

  

  

**As our MarTech lead, you will be:** 
  

  

* Ensuring that the MarTech solution is continuously monitored and analyzed to ensure performance and effectiveness of the solutions and initiate improvements and optimizations as needed
* Support the development of new personalization in SAS CI 360 tool based on different needs throughout the customer journey
* Ensure that we build the right capabilities throughout the MarTech stack to segment, orchestrate and activate experiences with high relevance for our customers, and that we can work data-driven throughout the process with e.g. A/B tests, follow-up and feedback insights and results to the analysis environments
* Orchestrating amongst the entire MarTech stack and solutions including MainFrame, Interactive, Centrica, Symplify, SAS CI 360 etc.


  

  

**Who are you?** 
  

  

 We are looking for you who have at least 5 years of experience from the MarTech stack and at least some years’ experience from a leadership role. We assume that you have a balanced mix of technical expertise, deep domain knowledge and a strong focus on customer satisfaction and high-impact outcomes.
   

  

 We are early in our establishment and are therefore looking for a leader with previous experience in establishing marketing automation platforms to create value for the customer. To thrive in this position, you need to be equally comfortable talking to technical experts as you are with those who have never worked with marketing automation. You will also be collaborating heavily with our digital tech departments
   

  

 As a person, you are analytical, structured, goal-oriented, passionate about customer experience and driving positive change in the organisation. You thrive in a collaborative and agile environment.
   

  

  

  

**What happens next?** 
  

  

 The deadline for applications is November 10th, but we are continuously reviewing applications, so send it as soon as possible!
   

  

  

  

**Contact:** 
  

  

 Questions about the position can be answered by the recruiter responsible, Bojana Mijocevic, tel. 076 695 15 33, and the hiring manager, Negar Zaerzadeh 0735262425
   

  

  

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!** 
  

  

*We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.*
*Are you curious about us and want to become one of our new colleagues?* 
*Of course, you are! Welcome with your application!*

title: NetSuite Functional Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
**What you’ll do**
 As a functional consultant you will be responsible for working directly with customers to document and validate their business requirements and map them to NetSuite functionality.
   

  

* Work with the customer to configure/customize NetSuite application to meet their business requirements.
* Attend project meetings and provide status on progress of activities and deliverables.
* Provide customers with as needed consulting and general assistance and be a 'go-to' resource for specific functional areas.


 You’ll be here to make customers success by unlocking capabilities and being their long-term partners in the Cloud.
   

  

* Demonstrate expertise to deliver functional and technical solutions on moderately complex customer engagements
* Lead the solution design and implementation aspects of engagement(s) ensuring high quality, integrated software solutions within constraints of time and budget


**Qualifications needed:**
* Consulting experience in common industry standard business practices, such as ERP, SFA/CRM, or Ecommerce
* Industry knowledge of any of Software / Services / Wholesale Distribution / Retail
* Ability to effectively implement an ERP, SFA/CRM or Ecommerce Solution
* Must be fluent in Swedish


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Why work at Oracle**
* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.

* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.

* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health

Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.

 That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.

title: Nätverksspecialist till Nexer
description:
Nexer expanderar och är ständigt på jakt efter talanger inom teknik och IT. Vi söker nu en nätverkstekniker till våra spännande uppdrag och kunder här i Göteborg. Om du har erfarenhet av arbete inom nätverk och vill fortsätta utvecklas inom detta område, är detta en chans för dig att ta nästa steg i karriären.


**Om tjänsten**


Som nätverkstekniker kommer du att använda din kompetens inom områden såsom routing, switching, LAN, WLAN och brandväggar. Dina arbetsuppgifter kan innefatta brandväggsförändringar, nätverkssäkerhet, konfigurering, automatisering, design av nät samt framtagning av olika typer av lösningar, i både stora och små projekt.

**Vi ser gärna att du**

* Har minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom nätverksområdet
* Har erfarenhet av network design, network security och network operation
* Har certifiering och/eller erfarenhet av någon/några av följande: Cisco, Checkpoint, Fortinet, Citrix och F5
* Har erfarenhet av scripting och automatisering
* Har erfarenhet av att leverera nätverks-IT-lösningar som en intern eller extern leverantör till flera kunder
* Kan översätta säkerhetskrav som NIST och CMMC till tekniska lösningar

**Meriterande kvalifikationer**

* Erfarenhet av arbete enligt ITIL och ISO 27001
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av NSX, Ansible och CyberArk
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta utifrån projektledningsprocesser och ramverk
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps och agila team
* God förståelse för ServiceNow change/problem/CMDB management moduler

**Plats** - Göteborg

**Medborgare** - Krav på endast svenskt medborgarskap


Arbetet utförs 100 % på plats

**Nexer som arbetsgivare**


Jobbar du på Nexer får du en modig och entreprenörsdriven arbetsgivare med internationell närvaro. Vi är stolta över att leda den digitala revolutionen och vara i teknikens framkant, alltid med ett agilt och framåtlutat förhållningssätt. Här får du unika möjligheter att drömma stort, agera smart och utvecklas. Vi är ett familjeägt bolag med långsiktiga strategier, vilket innebär att du är nära de som fattar beslut och kan vara med och påverka. Dessutom erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetspolicy, där det finns möjlighet att arbeta på distans när det passar dig och ditt uppdrag.

**Vår kultur**


Vår vision är Promising future – det är viktigt för oss att göra skillnad och bidra till en bättre framtid. Vi har ett engagemang för våra kunder och en uppriktig omtanke om varandra. Vi omfamnar mångfald och tror att människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter gör vårt arbete och vårt företag bättre. Vi värdesätter innovation och viljan att utvecklas och ta nästa steg – framåt och uppåt. Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet!

**Ansökan**: Du ansöker genom att fylla i ansökningsformuläret nedan. Tyvärr kan vi inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Har du några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta vår rekryterare, Amanda Stenberg, på amanda.stenberg@nexergroup.com.

title: DevOps
description:
**DevOps-konsult inom Linux - Utveckla framtidens IT-miljöer hos Sveriges ledande aktörer**


Vi söker en driven och kompetent **DevOps-konsult** med fokus på **Linux** till några av Sveriges mest spännande och säkerhetskritiska IT-miljöer. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom containerplattformar och automation, där säkerhet och tillförlitlighet är i fokus.

**Om rollen:** Som DevOps-konsult kommer du att arbeta med att implementera och underhålla containerplattformar baserade på **Red Hat Linux** hos våra kunder, som har höga krav på IT-säkerhet och driftar alla plattformar on-prem utan molnberoenden. Du kommer att vara delaktig i arbetet med att utveckla och optimera kundernas IT-miljöer, både tekniskt och strategiskt.


Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:

* Definiera och implementera en **DevOps-strategi och färdplan** i linje med kundens affärsmål.
* Automatisera infrastruktur och processer genom att utveckla robusta lösningar med **Ansible** och andra verktyg.
* Bygga och hantera skalbara **CI/CD-pipelines** med verktyg som Jenkins och GitLab för att säkerställa snabba, säkra och effektiva koddistributionsprocesser.
* Arbeta med **containerisering** (Docker, Kubernetes) för att designa, implementera och optimera plattformar för kostnadseffektivitet och säkerhet.
* Säkerställa att **säkerhet** är en integrerad del av hela utvecklings- och driftprocessen enligt **DevSecOps-principer**.
* Utvärdera och implementera nya teknologier och metoder för att kontinuerligt förbättra systemprestanda, säkerhet och teamets produktivitet.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team inom utveckling, QA och drift för att driva bästa praxis och säkerställa effektiva processer.

**Din profil:** För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:

* Minst **5 års erfarenhet** inom DevOps, med särskild kompetens inom Linux, automation och containerisering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med **Openshift Kubernetes** och ett starkt fokus på att **automatisera** repetitiva uppgifter för att öka effektiviteten.
* God vana av att hantera **CI/CD pipelines** och bygga robusta lösningar för kontinuerlig integration och leverans.
* Förmåga att snabbt identifiera och lösa problem i komplexa system och tillhandahålla effektiva lösningar.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska team.
* **Ledarskapsförmåga** och erfarenhet av att definiera och driva DevOps-strategier, samt mentorera och coacha teammedlemmar.

**Meriterande kvalifikationer:**

* Erfarenhet av att designa och optimera Kubernetesplattformar.
* Kunskap om **VMware** och andra virtualiseringslösningar.
* Relevant certifiering inom **DevOps** eller relaterade områden.


Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta i framkant av teknologiutvecklingen tillsammans med några av de mest kompetenta specialisterna i branschen. Är du nyfiken, framåt och söker nya utmaningar där du kan växa och utvecklas, både tekniskt och professionellt, då är det här rollen för dig.

 **Start**: Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare

 **Placeringsort:** Stockholm

**Ansökan:** Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match

 **Vad vi står för:**  

Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.


Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!

 **Varför ska du välja oss?**  

Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.

 *Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Integration Architect
description:
We are seeking an experienced integration architect to take our integration capabilities to new heights.



Simployer/AlexisHR is expanding its integration capabilities by offering integration solutions to our customers, seamlessly connecting with their existing IT ecosystems, which often include third-party systems such as recruiting software (ATS), CRM, Payroll, and IdP solutions.



Our dedicated integration team, supported by a robust platform built on Apache Camel, is at the forefront of these efforts.



As the integration architect, you will be part of a central team and impact how we work with integration. With a modern view, you will drive our integration capability forward, develop new integration requirements, and standardize existing ones while promoting a self-service mindset in building integrations.


**What you will do:**


* Set directions and manage activities related to the integration of software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet organizational and customer business requirements.
* Develop and maintain a robust integration architecture framework to facilitate scalable and secure connections with external systems.
* Drive the strategy on integration target architecture.
* Build and define an ecosystem of partners and “standard” integrations that connect to our data & onboarding APIs (e.g., pre-integrated HR systems, Payroll systems, Data analysis services, etc.).
* Ensure successful customer adoption of our solutions, connecting them to their other commercial software applications.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders in product & technology, sales departments, and customer organizations.
* Provide expert advice to product teams on the use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, system architecture, and best practices.


**Work with great people**
--------------------------


**Thomas Ellingsen**
DevOps Engineer


"I really enjoy my job because I work with a talented and supportive team. In my work I’m able to make mistakes and learn from them. This encourages me to take risks and continuously improve my skills."
**Martin Skåksrud**
Data Analyst


"I started my work in Simployer during my studies and got the opportunity to put learnings into practice. The combination of highly competent and friendly people makes Simployer a great place to be!"
**Maria Dahlqvist**
Senior Customer Consultant HCM


"In my work I help our customers to find the best way to use our products and how to simplify their processes. Sharing our experiences help us to develop ourselves, our customers and products."
**Henrik Sandström**
Tech Presale


"I have had the privilege to work for Simployer quite a few years in different roles. The company has always listened to my requests regarding competence development which has been very positive to me."
**Michał Sekuła**
Development Team Manager


"In Simployer amazing things are delivered by amazing people. With our culture where we take care of each other we are able to grow individually and as a company and go beyond any limitations."
**Ida Ljungberg**
Legal Adviser HR & Management


"Our HR Services would have been very useful for me in my previous HR jobs. So contributing to our customers within labour law, HR and payroll is one of the reasons why I really enjoy working here!"
Skills & Requirements


**What you will bring to the team:**


* A strong technical understanding of APIs, Distributed systems, Event sourcing, and integrations gained through working as a developer or integration architect with some level of customer contact.
* Proficiency in building scalable integration services, preferably with systems such as ERP and/or Payroll.
* Fluency in at least one OOP language, such as Java, Kotlin, or C#.
* Experience working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with Integration Systems such as Apache Camel, Jboss Fuse, WSO2, or Azure Logic Apps.
* Attention to detail and the ability to implement stable and scalable integrations
* Strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills



**What we see as a plus:**


* Experience in the identity & access management area
* Experience in the HRIS domain (HR master data, HR systems, Payroll data, and Employee & Organizational data).


**Our main tech stack:**



Java, C#, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Apache Camel, Docker, AWS, .Net Core, JavaScript, REACT, MS SQL, Rabbit MQ, Event Hub, Azure, Kubernetes, Containers, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Octopus, TeamCity, Azure.


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**



I'm Michał, and I serve as the Engineering Manager for the Connectivity team. I've been with Simployer for over 6 years, and it's only getting more interesting as time goes on. Our team's responsibilities include:


* Providing integration solutions to third parties, such as payroll systems.
* Offering advisory services for internal integration architecture.
* Managing responsibilities within the back-office platform.


**When you work with us, you can count on:**

* Great conversations about how to solve things (without drowning in endless meetings).


* A super supportive team that’s always ready to help—and maybe share a coffee or two.
* A fun ride as we tackle challenges together, because work should be enjoyable, right?



We’re all about keeping things easy-going and productive, with a few laughs along the way!


**Our hiring process**


* **HR Screening:** A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about you and your background (approx. 15 minutes).
* **Meeting with Michał**: A technical screening and a friendly introduction to get to know each other (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Personality and Logic Test**: A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs.
* **Technical Interview**: You'll meet with Michal again together with other Tech leaders for a more in-depth technical discussion and to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).
* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides.

  

**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.



**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.
  
Hilda Westin | Contact Person
 +46736590380

title: Azure Engineer
description:
Är du en engagerad Azure Engineer som vill göra skillnad?
  

  

Apoteket Tech söker nu en driven och tekniskt skicklig Azure Engineer för att stärka vårt team och bidra till utvecklingen av vår molninfrastruktur. Detta är en ny roll hos oss, vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att forma och utveckla det ramverk vi jobbar med.
  

Denna roll är idealisk för dig som trivs med att ha många kontaktytor inom verksamheten och med externa samarbetspartners, där du får använda din tekniska expertis för att koordinera och optimera Azure-baserade lösningar genom nära samarbete.
Som Azure Engineer på Apoteket
Kommer du att spela en central roll i att driva utvecklingen och förvaltningen av vår Azure-molninfrastruktur. Du kommer att arbeta med att säkerställa att våra system är skalbara, säkra och optimerade, samtidigt som du fungerar som en viktig länk mellan tekniska team och verksamheten. Din tekniska expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att vidareutveckla våra molnbaserade lösningar och säkerställa efterlevnad av plattformens riktlinjer.  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsområden**Designa och implementera Azure-baserade lösningar för att stödja organisationens behov.
Förbättra och förstärka vårt Azure-ramverk för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och framtidssäkerhet
Hantera och optimera Azure-miljöer för att säkerställa prestanda, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet.
Utveckla och underhålla tjänster på offentlig molnplattform samt stödja plattformens tekniska styrning och efterlevnad
Arbeta med drift, utveckling, underhåll och säkerhet för plattformen.
Fungera som Single Point of Contact mellan arkitekter, utvecklare och tekniker för att skapa lösningar för Apoteket.
Utveckla och implementera tydliga riktlinjer för arbete inom plattformens ramverk för att säkerställa efterlevnad och struktur
**Vem är du?**
Vi söker dig som är en passionerad erfarenhet av att arbeta i Azure-miljöer. Du är en problemlösare som trivs i en dynamisk miljö och som ständigt letar efter möjligheter att optimera och förbättra. Du har en stark förståelse för molnteknologier och är van vid att arbeta med moderna DevOps-principer.  

Utöver detta vill vi att du harMinst 3 års erfarenhet inom Azure
Bekant och skicklig med Microsoft Azure IaaS och PaaS-tjänster.
Erfarenhet av att implementera och hantera infrastruktur IaC med verktyg som Bicep eller ARM-mallar  

Erfarenhet av att definiera och bygga automation av IaC
Bekant med Azure Devops/Github
Svenska i tal och skrift
**När det känns rätt**  


Det finns många anledningar att jobba på Apoteket. Kalla det karriär eller livsval, men till oss söker man sig med drivkraften att vara en del av ett värdeskapande företag där vi möter människors behov och förväntningar. Vi har ett viktigt uppdrag att utföra där vi aktivt bidrar till att skapa “Ett liv i hälsa” för både kunder, medarbetare och samhället i stort. Oavsett roll eller funktion på Apoteket är du med och gör det enklare att må bra.  

Det hoppas vi. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Ansök nu och var med och bidra till att skapa ett liv i hälsa, för Sverige!
**Avdelning**
Tech
**Roll**
Azure Engineer
**Platser**
Stockholm
**Distansarbete**
Hybridarbete
**Ort**
Solna
**Arbetsplats**
Hybridarbete
**Anställningsform**
Tillsvidare
**Omfattning**
Heltid
**Sista ansökningsdag**
8 november 2024
**Email för kontakt**
niklas.ostlund@apoteket.se
**Facklig representant Unionen**
Per Skoglund (per.skoglund@apoteket.se)
**Facklig representant Sveriges Farmaceuter**
Kristina Maté (kristina.mate@apoteket.se)
**KONTAKT**


**Niklas Östlund**
Human Resources & Juridik
**Stockholm**
-------------


**Om Apoteket**
---------------


Apoteket AB ägs av svenska folket och pengarna vi tjänar går tillbaka till det gemensamma.
Vi har ett tydligt och samhällsviktigt uppdrag, att få människor i hela landet att må bra och kunna leva ett liv i hälsa. Hos oss har alla medarbetare en betydelsefull uppgift i att skapa ett bättre Sverige.
Med hundratals butiker och ännu fler ombud finns Apoteket på nästan tusen platser i landet och dygnet runt på nätet. Vi är hela Sveriges apotek, som hjälper och inspirerar människor både när de vill fortsätta att vara friska och när de är sjuka.
Vår kultur genomsyras av trovärdighet, initiativtagande, engagemang och omtänksamhet. Oavsett om det gäller kund eller medarbetare. Vi bryr oss helt enkelt om vår omvärld.
Vi bryter ständigt ny mark inom våra branschområden. Människors hälsa är viktig för oss. Var de än möter oss, kan de vara säkra på att Apoteket gör allt för att de ska må bra.

**Grundades** 1971
**Medarbetare** 3000 +
