title: Javautvecklare
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du en javautvecklare och vill förändra och förbättra samhället vi lever i? Här får du möjligheten. Just nu söker vi erfarna Javautvecklare till vårt team inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm!
   

  

 Som Javautvecklare på CGI kommer du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden. Vårt arbetssätt bygger på närhet och långsiktiga kundrelationer. Vi vill vara våra kunders innovativa och proaktiva partner som hjälper dem att nå framgång i sin verksamhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att ha spännande och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för analys, systemdesign, utveckling och implementation av system och lösningar. Som konsult hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att vara med och förändra på riktigt. Du får skapa lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder
   

  

 Vi förespråkar givetvis ett agilt arbetssätt och att arbeta tillsammans som team för att komma fram till bästa lösning. I rollen som konsult kan det både handla om att bli en del av våra kunders utvecklingsteam som att arbeta in-house på vårt CGI-kontor för våra kunder.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 I vårt team värdesätter vi engagemang och ambition och vi tycker att det är viktigt att du vill vara med och bidra till teamets gemensamma framgång. Som person ser vi att du är en teamspelare som både kan ge och ta i tekniska diskussioner såväl som förslag på lösningar. Vi ser också att det finns en vilja och nyfikenhet att lära sig nya saker, inte minst på teknisk nivå. Du är lyhörd och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kundens behov och hitta lämpliga lösningar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst 3 års erfarenhet eller längre av utveckling i Java och har erfarenhet av agil systemutvecklingsmetodik.
 **För den här tjänsten behöver du även behärska svenska och i tal och skrift.**
 Vi ser gärna att du har kompetens inom något av följande:
   

  

* Java
* Spring Boot
* IntelliJ, Eclipse, NetBeans
* Jenkins
* Kubernetes/Red Hat OpenShift
* Versionshantering
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD alt DevOps
* arbetat med testautomatisering
* arbetat med testdriven utveckling
* goda kunskaper i Unix/Linux


 Låter det intressant? Kul! Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Lina Fredriksson, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, på Lina.fredriksson@cgi.com.
   

  

 Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Senior AI / ML utvecklare ( Tensorflow, Pytorch )
description:
Är du passionerad för AI och maskininlärning? Vill du vara med i framkant av teknologiska innovationer? Vi söker nu en AI / ML utvecklare för en spännande kund.
   

  

 Vad vi söker i en AI / ML utvecklare:
   

  

* Högre utbildning inom datavetenskap, maskininlärning, eller liknande område
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med AI och maskininlärning
* Starka programmeringskunskaper i Python och erfarenhet med ML-ramverk som TensorFlow eller PyTorch
* Förmåga att utveckla och implementera komplexa algoritmer och modeller
* God förståelse för statistiska metoder och analys
* Utmärkt förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept på både svenska och engelska


 Meriterande kunskaper och erfarenheter:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade tjänster (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Erfarenhet av DevOps-principer och CI/CD pipelines
* Insikt i Hadoop eller Spark


 Som konsult hos Liminity får du:
   

  

* Spännande uppdrag hos en innovativ kund
* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom AI och ML
* Mentor-program för kontinuerlig personlig utveckling
* Omfattande utbildningsmöjligheter och certifieringar
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner
* Och mycket mer, läs mer på https://handbok.liminity.se


 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär inom AI och maskininlärning? Ansök idag och bli en del av Liminity - framtidens IT-konsultbolag!

title: Microsoft Security Specialist
description:
**About Us**



Integrity360 is an the largest independent cybersecurity provider in UK&I, with Security Operations Centers in Dublin & Sofia, employing 310+ employees, of which over 80% are technical. We help our clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats against the ever-evolving threat landscape. Our security first approach positions security as an enabler and empowers our clients to do business securely.

  

You would be joining Integrity360 at an immensely exciting time. In June 2021 the company received a strategic investment from August Equity (one of the UK’s most successful mid-market private equity firms). Our intention is to grow Integrity360 into the leading cyber services and solutions provider in Europe. The market for cybersecurity services has never been stronger and is growing at an aggressive rate. Integrity360 is one of the most respected and established service providers in the industry and is well positioned to achieve a market leadership position over the coming years. We believe we have significant opportunities for growth especially over the next 36 months. With the right levels of energy, tenacity and skill, your opportunity for personal success and contribution to our overall aspirations is considerable.

 **Job Role / Responsibilities**

  

The Technical consultant will work closely with the professional services and MDR teams to deliver growth and commercial success through working with and assisting in the Development of Integrity360’s Cybersecurity Services portfolio, and Managed Detection and Response in particular. We have a large portfolio of Endpoint protection vendors that we deliver Professional Services and training courses on. This individual will have a great understanding of cybersecurity needs and related solutions and managed services across its many domains and knows what excellence looks like to deliver on Enterprise customer expectations. In the past months we have built a very successful Microsoft Services Department that needs to be expanded due to customer demand specialising in Defender ATP and the M365 security stack. We have great demand from our customers to deploy Defender ATP and assistance in getting the most out of their M365\E5 product entitlement.

 **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Technical market research in the field of managed cyber security services, platforms, and solutions
* Assisting sales in winning deals, architecting deployments, and performing the technical delivery and training on the solutions.
* Technical input into business case development to justify proposed investments in managed services.
* Work with subject-matter experts in the business to build great services.
* Perform on site or remote assessments, consultancy and HLD and LLD design services featuring the M365 security stack, and more.

  


**Candidate requirements**

  

* Advanced Windows Server and Desktop operational and troubleshooting knowledge.
* Excellent understanding of Active Directory and Group Policy architecture
* Good knowledge of VMWare\HyperV, Azure
* Experience supporting and administration of Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Exchange, Exchange Online, Intune, Defender ATP and SCCM. M365 security stack consulting experience (Defender ATP all the way to Identity and Cloud is a must)
* Experience with Windows 7-11. Experience with Linux is a plus.
* Good understanding of TCP/IP networking.
* Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical personnel.
* Ability to manage client expectation.
* Ability to prioritise your own time.
* A real passion for technology.
* Excellent documentation skills.
* A sense of good customer service
* A strong team player
* Practical deployment, architecture, and consultative experience in scoping, installing, auditing, configuring, and training on the technical solutions mentioned in this document.
* Understanding of CASB, SSE, ZTNA, ATP, EDR, NDR, XDR, SOC, SIEM, SOAR, CNAP, DLP, NGAV, Web and Email security software, Vulnerability management, Mitre ATT&CK Framework Fundamentals, NIST / ISO/IEC 270001 Frameworks, HIPAA Governance Frameworks, GDPR Policy Frameworks, LM (Lockheed Martin) Cyber Kill Chain

  


**What you will bring to us:**

  

* Should have previous experience in professional services. managed security services, preferably in a next generation SOC environment or in an MSSP or MDR provider.
* Experience with Endpoint Security Implementation / Management
* Experience in Customer Service Environments
* Skills and experience in detection and response operations and services is a major plus.
* Good understanding of the security vendor and vendor category landscape
* Relevant Cyber Security certifications
* Initiative and focus on continuous improvement.
* Must be systems and process oriented, and a self-motivated learner.
* Experience with administering enterprise servers and other systems.
* Proficiency in all aspects of system administration and engineering of Microsoft technologies to deploy and maintain global infrastructure services in our enterprise with an emphasis on the platforms mentioned.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Must be educated to degree level or similar
* CompTIA A+
* CompTIA N+
* CompTIA Security+
* Microsoft – MS-500
* Microsoft – AZ-500
* Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Intune / Endpoint Manager Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Active Directory Domain Administration
* Microsoft Azure Active Directory Management
* Microsoft Data Loss Protection Management / Configuration
* Microsoft PIM (Identity and Access Management Management) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Security Centre Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Cloud App Security

  


**Additional Knowledge (will contribute to your application):**


* Trend, Trellix\Mcafee\Skyhigh, Carbon black, Varonis, CrowdStrike, Mimecast, Rapid 7, Qualys, Splunk, Vectra, CyberArk, Microsoft Sentinel, AZ-800, AZ-801, SC-100, SC-200, SC-400
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: Data Specialist
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Define IAM Domain Data Schema.
* Propose the most efficient and scalable data schemas tailored to the needs of the IAM domain.
* This involves understanding the current IAM systems, identifying gaps, and proposing improvements in the data structure  

Establish Data Governance and Ownership.
* Set clear roles and responsibilities for data management, define data quality metrics, and ensure compliance with internal and external data policies.
* Create comprehensive documentation outlining best practices for data modeling specific to the IAM domain.
* Collaborate with Engineering Teams on Event Instrumentation.
* Work closely with the engineering teams to set instrumentation requirements and to ensure the collected data is accurate and actionable.
* Lead Project Planning and Execution.
* Break down the overall project into manageable tasks and phases.
* Lead the planning and execution efforts, ensuring that all tasks are completed on time and meet the defined objectives.


**Requirements**


* Experience in the development of data products (using Python, SQL).
* You have a track record of taking open-ended analytics goals and translating them into production-quality datasets.
* You are comfortable stepping through ETL processes and tracing data flows through complex DAGs and you are experienced with DBT.
* You are knowledgeable in data modeling, data access and data storage techniques.
* You have strong proficiency using SQL in cloud data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) and are comfortable with performance optimization, data partitioning, and window functions.
* Experience with GCP tooling is a plus.
* You are a communicative person who values building strong relationships with colleagues and partners and enjoys mentoring and teaching others.
* You are able to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity, with only high-level direction  

Improve data quality through testing, tooling and continuously evaluating performance.

title: ML Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining the company’s product by hands-on ML development.
* Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways.
* Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users.
* Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality.
* Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners.
* You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice -You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts.
* You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages.
* Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus.
* You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models.
* You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS.
* You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation.
* You have a desire to drive business impact.

title: Senior Analytics engineer
description:
**Start****24-11-2024****Duration****7-9 months**
  
User Platform (UP) is a studio in client’s Platform mission. The Platform mission is responsible for building the tooling and support platforms for the engineering teams at the company. UP owns the platforms for authentication, authorization, user account data, and user experience configuration at the company. UP was formed with the mission to provide a secure platform that helps users establish their identities and manage their account data on different surfaces. UP also enables teams around the client to experiment on and customize the user experience in new and more refined ways. User Platform is responsible for many of the core services needed for our client to function and provide 380M+ users across the world access to the audio experience they desire.  

  

Description  

During this assignment we want to enable anyone at the client, including the UP studio, to understand users’ identity and access patterns effectively, to form better experiences within user acquisition and retention, strengthen account security as well as improve the global client product decision making. Achieving this requires a significant investment in enhancing our IAM data health and structure.  

  

We are looking for a talented, engaged senior analytics engineer to help our teams working on large and highly available data sets that form the backbone of our product experience for hundreds of millions of users across the globe.  

  

The projects objectives  

* Define IAM Domain Data Schema
* Propose the most efficient and scalable data schemas tailored to the needs of the IAM domain. This involves understanding the current IAM systems, identifying gaps, and proposing improvements in the data structure
* Establish Data Governance and Ownership
* Set clear roles and responsibilities for data management, define data quality metrics, and ensure compliance with internal and external data policies. Create comprehensive documentation outlining best practices for data modeling specific to the IAM domain.
* Collaborate with Engineering Teams on Event Instrumentation
* Work closely with the engineering teams to set instrumentation requirements and to ensure the collected data is accurate and actionable
* Lead Project Planning and Execution
* Break down the overall project into manageable tasks and phases. Lead the planning and execution efforts, ensuring that all tasks are completed on time and meet the defined objectives

  

What you’ll do  

* You have 5+ years of experience in the development of data products (using Python, SQL)
* You have a track record of taking open-ended analytics goals and translating them into production-quality datasets
* You are comfortable stepping through ETL processes and tracing data flows through complex DAGs and you are experienced with DBT
* You are knowledgeable in data modeling, data access and data storage techniques.
* You have strong proficiency using SQL in cloud data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) and are comfortable with performance optimization, data partitioning, and window functions. Experience with GCP tooling is a plus
* You are a communicative person who values building strong relationships with colleagues and partners and enjoys mentoring and teaching others
* You are able to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity, with only high-level direction


Improve data quality through testing, tooling and continuously evaluating performance  

Start Date: 2024-11-04


End Date: 2025-05-04

title: Senior Sales Engineer - Sweden
description:
**About Us**
Sophos is a global leader and innovator of advanced security solutions that defeat cyberattacks, including Managed Detection and Response (MDR) and incident response services and a broad portfolio of endpoint, network, email, and cloud security technologies. As one of the largest pure-play cybersecurity providers, Sophos defends more than 600,000 organizations and more than 100 million users worldwide from active adversaries, ransomware, phishing, malware, and more. Sophos’ services and products connect through the Sophos Central management console and are powered by Sophos X-Ops, the company’s cross-domain threat intelligence unit. Sophos X-Ops intelligence optimizes the entire Sophos Adaptive Cybersecurity Ecosystem, which includes a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity and information technology vendors. Sophos provides cybersecurity-as-a-service to organizations needing fully managed security solutions. Customers can also manage their cybersecurity directly with Sophos’ security operations platform or use a hybrid approach by supplementing their in-house teams with Sophos’ services, including threat hunting and remediation. Sophos sells through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos is headquartered in Oxford, U.K. More information is available at www.sophos.com. **Role Summary:**
The Field Sales Engineer is a pre-sales engineering role providing technical expertise in sales engagements. They will develop sales strategies for customer accounts and actively manage multiple concurrent PoC’s to drive enterprise-wide deployments of Sophos products and services.
### **What you Will Do**

+ Provide presale technical expertise aligned with the sales team focusing on our most valuable partners and accounts.
+ Build meaningful relationships with key customer technical decision-makers to understand customer requirements and recommend appropriate solutions.
+ Serve as trusted advisors and technical lead on Sophos next-gen portfolio products and services opportunities
+ Perform health checks and policy reviews to drive cross-sell and deepen customer relationships.
+ Conduct and manage technical virtual and onsite meetings, product demos, and proof of concepts with customers.
+ Provides ﬁeld-based support for events and face-to-face time with prospects and customers.
+ Own and drive the technical sales cycle from early opportunity technical qualiﬁcation to technical closure.
+ Provide support for customer success motions to promote cross-selling and portfolio expansion within the current Sophos customer base.
+ Work with customers primarily within Sweden, Denmark and Finland with occasional engagement with the wider Nordic region.
+ This role will be customer / partner facing and as such, travel is expected to be 25% - 50% in region and on occasion to the Nordics and UK.

### **What you Will Bring**

+ Prior experience and expertise working within a technical pre-sales role.
+ Exceptional Network Security Knowledge, ideally with endpoint technology exposure.
+ The ability to build effective and successful relationships with key customers / partners.
+ Able to work independently and as part of a wider team.
+ Be able to instil confidence and become the trusted advisor for all technical aspects.
+ Prior knowledge of MDR and Security As A Service would be highly beneficial.
+ Swedish and English business level communication skills will be required with additional languages a bonus.

#B2
#LI-SK1 **Ready to Join Us?**
At Sophos, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to fuel innovation. Research shows that candidates sometimes hesitate to apply if they don't check every box in a job description. We challenge that notion. Your unique experiences and skills might be exactly what we need to enhance our team. Don't let a checklist hold you back – we encourage you to apply. **What's Great About Sophos?*** Sophos operates a remote-first working model, making remote work the primary option for most employees. However, some roles may necessitate a hybrid approach. Please refer to the location details in our job postings for further information.
* Our people – we innovate and create, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit
* Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy
* Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities
* Global employee sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental footprint
* Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp
* Global wellbeing days for employees to relax and recharge
* Monthly wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing

 **Our Commitment To You**
We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we’re committed to ensuring equality of opportunity. We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants who can contribute to the diversity of our team. All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation. We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know. **Data Protection**
If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos. If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights. If you have any questions about Sophos’ data protection practices, please contact dataprotection@sophos.com.

title: Network Architect
description:
Network Architect


Swedium Global is looking for a Network Architect for one of its customer


Location: Stockholm  

Start Date: ASAP


Responsibilities  

* Take lead on design work for new solutions supporting business initiatives requiring new functions and services
* Develop, build, and manage the Network, transforming our legacy network to network as a code with a service layer.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and in accordance with roadmap


o Provide technical engineering, best practices concerning the overall Network  

* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and in accordance with roadmap
* Analyze, design, develop and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Monitor performance, ensure availability, and reliability.
* Documentation of service design package and service description
* Documentation of guidelines, processes, and routines
* Setting and maintaining network standards
* Being an advisor in Network design, plan, build and operate within the Network domain.
* Cooperate and coordinate with stakeholder’s contribution with Network knowledge to reach business needs
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, making recommendations as needed to help our company develop
* Understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* See the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas.

Qualifications

o Handling multivendor environment (e.g. Cisco, HPE)  

o Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools companies.  

o CCNP or higher (CCIE/CISSP a plus)
  
Job Overview


* Location : Stockholm, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Cisco ISE, Wireless LAN Controllers, Routing, Switching, Designing, SDWAN, Disco DevNet, Network Automation, CCNP or higher

title: Integration Architect
description:
We are seeking an experienced integration architect to take our integration capabilities to new heights.



Simployer/AlexisHR is expanding its integration capabilities by offering integration solutions to our customers, seamlessly connecting with their existing IT ecosystems, which often include third-party systems such as recruiting software (ATS), CRM, Payroll, and IdP solutions.



Our dedicated integration team, supported by a robust platform built on Apache Camel, is at the forefront of these efforts.



As the integration architect, you will be part of a central team and impact how we work with integration. With a modern view, you will drive our integration capability forward, develop new integration requirements, and standardize existing ones while promoting a self-service mindset in building integrations.


**What you will do:**


* Set directions and manage activities related to the integration of software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet organizational and customer business requirements.
* Develop and maintain a robust integration architecture framework to facilitate scalable and secure connections with external systems.
* Drive the strategy on integration target architecture.
* Build and define an ecosystem of partners and “standard” integrations that connect to our data & onboarding APIs (e.g., pre-integrated HR systems, Payroll systems, Data analysis services, etc.).
* Ensure successful customer adoption of our solutions, connecting them to their other commercial software applications.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders in product & technology, sales departments, and customer organizations.
* Provide expert advice to product teams on the use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, system architecture, and best practices.

  
Skills & Requirements


**What you will bring to the team:**


* A strong technical understanding of APIs, Distributed systems, Event sourcing, and integrations gained through working as a developer or integration architect with some level of customer contact.
* Proficiency in building scalable integration services, preferably with systems such as ERP and/or Payroll.
* Fluency in at least one OOP language, such as Java, Kotlin, or C#.
* Experience working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with Integration Systems such as Apache Camel, Jboss Fuse, WSO2, or Azure Logic Apps.
* Attention to detail and the ability to implement stable and scalable integrations
* Strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills



**What we see as a plus:**


* Experience in the identity & access management area
* Experience in the HRIS domain (HR master data, HR systems, Payroll data, and Employee & Organizational data).


**Our main tech stack:**



Java, C#, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Apache Camel, Docker, AWS, .Net Core, JavaScript, REACT, MS SQL, Rabbit MQ, Event Hub, Azure, Kubernetes, Containers, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Octopus, TeamCity, Azure.


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**



I'm Michał, and I serve as the Engineering Manager for the Connectivity team. I've been with Simployer for over 6 years, and it's only getting more interesting as time goes on. Our team's responsibilities include:


* Providing integration solutions to third parties, such as payroll systems.
* Offering advisory services for internal integration architecture.
* Managing responsibilities within the back-office platform.


**When you work with us, you can count on:**

* Great conversations about how to solve things (without drowning in endless meetings).


* A super supportive team that’s always ready to help—and maybe share a coffee or two.
* A fun ride as we tackle challenges together, because work should be enjoyable, right?



We’re all about keeping things easy-going and productive, with a few laughs along the way!


**Our hiring process**


* **HR Screening:** A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about you and your background (approx. 15 minutes).
* **Meeting with Michał**: A technical screening and a friendly introduction to get to know each other (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Personality and Logic Test**: A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs.
* **Technical Interview**: You'll meet with Michal again together with other Tech leaders for a more in-depth technical discussion and to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).
* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides.

  

**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Machine learning Engineer
description:
**Start****24-11-2024****Duration****4-6 months**
  
We in the Machine Learning product area in the Activation, Retention, Conversion studio are focused on building robust and scalable machine learning solutions that can personalize activation, retention and conversion funnels to improve important business metrics like SUBS and MAU.  

  

Through our messaging platform as well as other discovery & conversion surfaces, we communicate with users to connect them with valuable audio content and to help the business grow.  

  

Our vision is to build the machine learning models and infrastructure that offers a fully personalized and ML-optimized experience for listeners throughout their user journey that powers every messaging and conversion campaign.  

  

This role sits in a squad called White Mouse that owns the optimization of plan upsell targeting across the company. Our key problem areas are: What plan should the user be upsold on discovery surfaces? How should we communicate the user on consideration surfaces? How should we balance upselling plans vs other paid products? We are also working on projects around ad load optimization.  

  

What you’ll do  

* Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining the company’s product by hands-on ML development
* Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
* Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
* Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality
* Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in your mission and across the company Who you are


-You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice -You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts  

* You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages
* Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus
* You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models
* You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
* You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation
* You have a desire to drive business impact
  

Start Date: 2024-11-25  

End Date: 2025-11-25

title: Grafisk Designer/ Digital designer till AcadeMedia (vikariat)
description:
**Designteamet på AcadeMedias marknadsavdelning i Göteborg behöver förstärkas med en grafisk designer/ digital designer. Som anställd hos oss kommer du att tillhöra ett ambitiöst, kreativt och nyfiket team. Vårt kontor är centralt beläget, ett stenkast från Göteborgs centralstation.**


**Om tjänsten**  

Som grafisk designer/ digital designer hos oss på AcadeMedia producerar du design och kommunikation över flera digitala kanaler. Du växlar vant mellan att designa för rörlig bild, layout och typografi för digitala medier men har inga problem att skifta om till trycksaksproduktion.



Du kommer att tillhöra ett team av designers och arbeta tätt tillsammans med utvalda marknadsansvariga och marknadskoordinatorer när du producerar content för flera olika varumärken. Tillsammans sätter ni mottagarnas behov i fokus och hjälper vårdnadshavare och ungdomar över hela Sverige att göra välgrundade skolval.

  


**Om dig**  

För oss är det viktigt att du har rätt inställning till ditt hantverk, dina kollegor och vårt viktiga uppdrag. Vi söker en driven lagspelare med en lösningsorienterad attityd som kan jobba både i grupp och självständigt. Du har förmågan att tänka både kreativt och konceptuellt och är bra på att strukturera upp ditt arbete och göra prioriteringar. Det är en fördel, men inget krav, om du har några års erfarenhet av liknande arbete. Vi förväntar oss att du har en passion för grafisk design och håller dig uppdaterad på de senaste trenderna.



Övriga kompetenser


* Mycket goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud; däribland InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator och After Effects
* Erfarenhet av både trycksaksproduktion och digital produktion såsom motion graphics
* Goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Är du den vi söker?**  

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan innehållande CV, portfolio och personligt brev där du motiverar varför du söker dig till just denna tjänst. Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum, så vänta inte med ansökan om du tror du är rätt person för rollen. Vi är därför tacksamma att få din ansökan så snart som möjligt och återkommer med besked till dig så snart vi får möjlighet. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig. Sista ansökningsdag är 3e november 2024.


**Tjänstens omfattning och placering**  

Tjänsten är ett vikariat tom mars 2026 med goda möjligheter till förlängning. Startdatum är flexibelt. Du kommer att vara placerad på vårt kontor i Göteborg,  

Vid frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryteringsansvarig Jonatan Björklund på jonatan.bjorklund@academedia.se


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**


*Vi har gjort vårt medieval för rekrytering och undanber oss därför kontakt med annonssäljare eller säljare av andra rekryteringstjänster*

title: Data Scientist – applied data analysis of IoT devices
description:
Job Title
Data Scientist – applied data analysis of IoT devices
Job Description*At Axis Communications we are passionate about creating a smarter and safer world! Now we are looking for our next Data Scientist!*
Your future team  

You will be an important part of the Diagnostics and Data Management team where we enable data-driven development for Axis.
Your new team consists of experienced Software Engineers, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists responsible for collecting, processing, storing, and analyzing anonymized data from IoT devices, in the cloud and on-prem.
We provide solutions to access and visualize the data and perform analysis of the data. The area is of strategic importance for Axis with great development potential moving forward. Our stakeholders are within R&D, Product management, and Operations.
We are convinced that self-managed and engaged teams are the foundation of an innovative work culture and trust is a key part of this. This enables Axis to innovate and improve products and services, and by that stay ahead of our competitors.
What you’ll do as a Data Scientist  

You will transform information into knowledge!
Your typical day at Axis will include one or more of the following:* Explore and transform data in Jupyter notebooks
* Develop and improve dbt models, and participate in code reviews
* Collaborate with stakeholders regarding ongoing requests and bringing new ideas.
* Collaborate with teammates in hands-on sessions to solve analysis tasks together
* Use various tools, for example notebooks, and present slides and dashboards to convey insights and results for stakeholders and in different forums
* Engage in our stand-ups and planning sessions to keep the team aligned, maintain momentum, and quickly address any issues.

Who are we looking for?  

You, who are* Excited about tech and data
* Comfortable in Python and/or SQL and experienced in Linux + Git
* Equipped with a diverse statistical toolbox for transforming data into insights

You are curious and want to learn new things and share your knowledge with others. You are a structured and self-going person that likes to take responsibility for your tasks, and you are good at seeing the big picture. You recognize the importance of networking with others, inside as well as outside the team. You have a suitable education like Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, or similar.
As teamwork is crucial for Axis, we believe it is important that you can contribute to a good team spirit promoting a creative and stimulating work environment.
We see it as a bonus that you have* Experience working with databases, for example ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.
* Experience in working closely with Data engineers
* Experience in visualization/BI-tool (ex. Apache Superset or other)

What can Axis do for you?  

Axis is an exciting company, already the world leader in our field - network video. As an engineer at Axis, you have the opportunity to steer your competence development and grow in the fields that you find interesting. Axis values creativity and promotes personal growth. Here you will have the opportunity to work with colleagues from all parts of the organization, making it possible to connect and exchange knowledge and experience.
We welcome your application and look forward to the possibility of you joining us!
Ready to act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. Would you like to grow with us?
Find out more from the recruiting manager, Tory Li, by phone at +46 46 272 1800
We review applications continuously!  

Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2024-11-06*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Strategic Partner Account Manager, Northern Europe
description:
Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection—providing natively integrated, all-in-one solutions that monitor, control, and protect the data that businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Strategic Partner Account Manager to join our mission to create a #CyberFit future and protect all data, applications, and systems across any environment.



The Strategic Partner Account Manager, you will drive when establishing, managing, and growing Acronis' presence within existing and new service provider partners. This role will work in close collaboration with the sales managers and leaders at each of our service providers to increase Acronis' revenue, customer base, and market share within their business. The Strategic Partner Account Manager role is ideal for a top seller with strong strategic and tactical sales management skills. The sales professional will balance short-term sales activities with long-term strategic initiatives. The impact of decisions and actions taken locally may be felt globally due to the scale of Acronis' largest service provider partners.



**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* Establish, manage, and grow Acronis' presence within existing and new service provider partners
* Grow incremental Annual Recurring Revenue/sales through the management of sales initiatives
* Responsible for training, onboarding, and enablement of new/prospective service providers
* Expected to deliver monthly, quarterly and annual partner forecast/pipeline and business activity to the Acronis sales management team
* Recruit, onboard, and train new MSP partners
* Conduct Quarterly Business Reviews and Quarterly Business Planning Sessions with assigned SP partners
* Enable cross-functional cooperation between Sales, Marketing, Professional Services, Acronis Academy, and other teams including Acronis executives as necessary
* Work with Service Providers to sell to their existing base of customers to increase adoption of Acronis Cyber Protection services
* Collaborate across multiple departments, including sales, marketing, finance, business development, engineering, and operations, to ensure seamless account management and communication


**WHAT YOU BRING**


* 5+ years of total sales/account management experience, relevant experience in backup, disaster recovery, security, and/or closely related cloud technologies is a must
* 3+ years of strategic large account management experience is cumpulsory
* Solid strategic business development, planning, and acumen, along with strong tactical implementation sales skills
* Technical aptitude to deliver sales and product training, with a strong understanding of product positioning and client technical needs
* Outstanding organizational, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
* Working knowledge of MS Office and Management of daily activities through CRM applications including Sales Force
* Regional travel is required in the role. Must be willing to travel on a frequent basis, up to 50% of the time
* Strong written and verbal English communication and interpersonal skills


**WHO WE ARE**



Acronis is a global cyber protection company that provides natively integrated cybersecurity, data protection, and endpoint management for managed service providers (MSPs), small and medium businesses (SMBs), enterprise IT departments and home users. Our all-in-one solutions are highly efficient and designed to identify, prevent, detect, respond, remediate, and recover from modern cyberthreats with minimal downtime, ensuring data integrity and business continuity. We offer the most comprehensive security solution on the market for MSPs with our unique ability to meet the needs of diverse and distributed IT environments.



A Swiss company founded in Singapore in 2003, Acronis offers over twenty years of innovation with 15 offices worldwide and more than 1800 employees in 50+ countries. Acronis Cyber Protect is available in 26 languages in 150 countries and is used by over 20,000 service providers to protect over 750,000 businesses.



Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities we serve. Mutual trust, respect and belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of our team. Each member of our "A-Team" plays an instrumental role in driving the success of our innovative and expanding business. We seek individuals who excel in dynamic, global environments and have a never give up attitude, contributing to our collective growth and impact.


*Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*



#LI-MC1

title: Integration Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic integration engineer to strengthen our integration team.



Simployer/AlexisHR is expanding its integration capabilities by offering integration solutions to our customers, seamlessly connecting with their existing IT ecosystems, which often include third-party systems such as recruiting software (ATS), CRM, Payroll, and IdP solutions.



Our dedicated integration team, supported by a robust platform built on Apache Camel, is at the forefront of these efforts.



As an integration engineer, you will advance our integration capabilities in a central team. You will have a direct impact on how we connect systems by implementing new integration requirements and standardizing existing ones while promoting a self-service approach to building integrations.


**What you will do:**


* Collaborate with the integration team on all activities related to integrating software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet both organizational and customer business requirements.
* Implement and maintain robust integration solutions to facilitate scalable and secure connections with external systems.
* Contribute to the development of the integration target architecture strategy.
* Assist in building an ecosystem of partners and "standard" integrations that connect to our data & onboarding APIs.
* Ensure successful customer adoption of our solutions, connecting them to their other commercial software applications.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders in product & technology teams, sales departments, and customer organizations.
* Provide technical expertise to product teams on the use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, and best practices.

  
Skills & Requirements


**What you will bring to the team:**


* A solid technical understanding of APIs, Distributed systems, Event sourcing, and integrations gained through experience working as a developer or integration engineer with some level of customer contact.
* Proficiency in building scalable integration services, preferably with systems such as ERP and/or Payroll.
* Fluency in at least one OOP language such as Java, Kotlin, or C#.
* Experience working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with Integration Systems such as Apache Camel, Jboss Fuse, WSO2, or Azure Logic Apps
* Attention to detail and the ability to implement stable and scalable integrations
* Strong analytical abilities and great communication skills


**What we see as a plus:**


* Experience in the identity & access management area
* Experience in the HRIS domain (HR master data, HR systems, Payroll data and Employee & Organizational data)


**Our main tech stack:**
  

Java, C#, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Apache Camel, Docker, AWS, .Net Core, JavaScript, REACT, MS SQL, Rabbit MQ, Event Hub, Azure, Kubernetes, Containers, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Octopus, TeamCity, Azure.


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**

I'm Michał, and I serve as the Engineering Manager for the Connectivity team. I've been with Simployer for over 6 years, and it's only getting more interesting as time goes on. Our team's responsibilities include:


* Providing integration solutions to third parties, such as payroll systems.
* Offering advisory services for internal integration architecture.
* Managing responsibilities within the back-office platform.


**When you work with us, you can count on:**

* Great conversations about how to solve things (without drowning in endless meetings).
* A super supportive team that’s always ready to help—and maybe share a coffee or two.
* A fun ride as we tackle challenges together, because work should be enjoyable, right?



We’re all about keeping things easy-going and productive, with a few laughs along the way!


**Our Hiring Process**


* **HR Screening:** A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about you and your background (approx. 15 minutes).
* **Meeting with Michał**: A technical screening and a friendly introduction to get to know each other (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Personality and Logic Test**: A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs.
* **Technical Interview**: You'll meet with Michal again together with other Tech leaders for a more in-depth technical discussion and to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).
* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides.

  

**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Principal, Specialized Software, AI, Office of the CTO
description:
**Note:** By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Warsaw, Poland; Vienna, Austria; Helsinki, Finland; Oslo, Norway; Stockholm, Sweden.
  
  

**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in a technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 15 years of experience in software, hardware, or infrastructure engineering, with a focus on technical innovation and engineering leadership.
* Experience in building AI products.
* Experience leading and directing strategic initiatives without authority.
* Experience coaching executive technical leaders and senior practitioners on cloud and AI adoption, leverage, benefits, and pitfalls.
* Experience transitioning first-of products to scaled products and platforms, impacting the product and business strategy of an organization.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree or PhD in an AI related field.
* Experience as a recognized expert in the field of AI, with examples of products, platforms, or experiences built with AI at their core.
* Experience as an entrepreneur or in a startup within a larger organization.


About the job
  
  

Small teams, operating with context, empowerment, and access to the world’s most promising technology, often create the breakthroughs that define markets.
  
For the last 8 years, the Office of the CTO (OCTO) in Google Cloud has leveraged this insight, combined with the direct sponsorship of the Cloud CTO and CEO, to help our most strategic customers transform their organizations using small, adaptable teams and methods, while concurrently supporting our internal collaborators as they take these early technology proof points and build them into scaled products and platforms.
  
As a Principal Engineer within the Office of the CTO in Google Cloud, you will create and reinforce the human pathways between Google Engineering and our most strategic customers and partners, allowing all of us to start from loosely defined, potentially transformative market opportunities and convert them into new, technology-enabled businesses. You will help our customers create their future and help us create the future of Google by continuously tuning our innovation system and products to the needs of the world’s most complex enterprises.
  
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Create and reinforce the human pathways between Google Engineering and our strategic customers and partners, allowing all of us to start from loosely defined, potentially transformative market opportunities and convert into new, technology-enabled businesses.
* Partner with Engineering and Product teams to identify and test strategic, horizontal opportunities for differentiation across roadmaps.
* Identify future state-of-cloud products and partner closely with technical teams to chart how we’d bring those future states to life.
* Help our most strategic customers and partners work through the complexity of adopting cutting edge cloud and AI technologies through expert advice.
* Inspire others to work through difficult and disruptive endeavors through sharing experiences, successes, failures and the human side of advanced technology development and adoption.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
We are seeking a dynamic CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist for our client inthe automotive industry, for an engaging full-time assignment starting on 15th December 2024, running through to 30th September 2025. Based in Gothenburg or offsite, this role is ideal for a self-driven professional passionate about optimizing customer journeys through marketing automation.
  
  

**About the role:**  

As a Marketing Automation Specialist, you'll work in a high-paced environment, managing both local and global send-outs. You’ll contribute as an expert to ongoing development projects while continually improving and maintaining the existing setup within Salesforce Marketing Cloud. You will report to the CRM Operations team lead and collaborate closely with other teams to optimize customer communication throughout various lifecycle stages.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Develop and implement marketing automation practices, focusing on setting up, managing, and optimizing customer journeys to ensure targeted and effective communication.
  
Collaborate with the CRM Commercial team to provide expertise in Salesforce Marketing Cloud for global projects, specifically supporting the “Order to Delivery” and “Ownership” phases.
  
Build and maintain marketing assets including emails, cloud pages, and other content in Marketing Cloud.
  
Oversee segmentation and send-outs for customer communications, ensuring precision and relevance.
  
Set up and manage trigger-based journeys, ensuring consistency and best practices across markets.
  
Test and optimize existing journeys regularly, working with data and enhancing testing capabilities to meet business logic.
  
Work closely with the CRM Systems team for continuous improvements and enhancements in Marketing Cloud.
  
Document technical setups such as data segmentation rules, SQL automations, AMP scripts, and email structures to align with overall blueprints.
  
Conduct training sessions and maintain up-to-date guidelines and documentation for Marketing Cloud usage.
  
  

**About you:**  

You are an analytical and detail-focused professional with a strong background in marketing automation. You thrive in fast-paced settings and excel at thinking on your feet to adapt to new challenges. Your proactive and flexible approach ensures you deliver efficient solutions and improvements consistently.
  
  

**Experience and skills:**  

Certification as a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist (additional certifications are a plus).
  
Proven experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and hands-on expertise in managing customer journeys.
  
Knowledge in data segmentation, SQL, and AMP scripting.
  
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and a continuous improvement approach.
  
Self-driven and proactive, with flexibility to adapt in a dynamic environment.
  
Experience working in cross-functional teams, providing expertise and support for global and local projects.
  
  

**About the assignment:**  

For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: CRM Marketing Automation Specialist (Senior)
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
  

We are seeking a highly skilled and driven CRM Marketing Automation Specialist to join our client’s team. In this role, you will operate in a fast-paced environment, contributing to both local and global marketing campaigns. You will be pivotal in the continuous development, maintenance, and improvement of the company’s existing CRM and marketing automation setup, with Salesforce Marketing Cloud as the primary tool.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Develop, implement, and optimize marketing automation strategies, ensuring efficient and targeted communication with contacts and customers.
* Collaborate with the CRM Commercial team to provide expertise on Marketing Cloud’s capabilities and execute global marketing projects, with a focus on the “Order to Delivery” and “Ownership” phases of the customer lifecycle.
* Build, maintain, and optimize content such as emails, cloud pages, and other communication assets within Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Manage customer segmentation and execute trigger-based marketing journeys.
* Support local markets by providing best practices, tools, and assistance with local activities.
* Conduct regular testing and optimize existing marketing automation journeys, ensuring alignment with business logic.
* Work closely with the CRM Systems team to improve Marketing Cloud’s functionality.
* Document technical setups including data segmentation rules, SQL queries, automations, AMP scripting, and email templates.
* Lead training sessions on Marketing Cloud and maintain relevant guidelines and documentation.


**Required Skills:**  

* Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist certification is required; additional certifications are a plus.
* Strong skills in Marketing Automation, CRM, and specifically Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive and self-driven mindset.
* Ability to think quickly and adapt to changing situations.
* Highly analytical and detail-oriented.


The Team
  
  

You will be part of the CRM Communication team, consisting of 11 members. This team is divided into three sub-teams:
  
* CRM Commercial: 3 project leaders
* CRM Operations: 3 Marketing Automation specialists and 1 team lead
* CRM Systems & Analytics: 1 system owner/SME, 1 developer, and 1 analytics expert


**Start Date:**  

2024-12-15
  
  

**End Date:**  

2025-09-30

Apply Now!
  
  

We review applications continuously and may close the position before the deadline, so if you’re interested, we encourage you to apply immediately.
  
  

**Required Languages:**  

* English: Expert level

title: Machine Learning engineer
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
  

För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

Job description
  
  

**The primary tasks as a Machine Learning Engineer are:**  

* Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company.
* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
* Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
* Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.


**Required skills and experiences:**  

* Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Have 4+ years professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
* A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
* Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
* Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud.
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
* Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
* Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
* Familiar with agile ways of working team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.


**Remote:** 50%
  
  

**Assignment Period:** 2024.10.21 - 2025.03.31
  
  

**Submission deadline:** 2024-10-20

title: Software Developer III
description:
As the technology firm that created the mobile world and a rich history of 145 years of building ground-breaking solutions and innovative technologies supported by 60,000+ patents, Ericsson has made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you are welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.
Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions (BEWS) is the group responsible for leading Ericsson’s Enterprise Networking and Security business. Our growing product portfolio spans across wide area networks, local area networks and enterprise security. We are the #1 global market leader in Wireless-WAN based enterprise connectivity solutions and are growing fast in enterprise Private 5G networks and Secure Access Services Edge (SASE) solutions.
How Will You Contribute to the Company?
We are looking for a Backend Engineer who wants to join the most dynamic and fast-moving team in Ericsson! Someone who wants to build and create new paths for Ericsson in Industry 4.0. Our team has a key role in creating new business within local cellular connectivity. You will be engaged in the whole process from creating customer scenarios to translating into technology.
Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. You won’t develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.
Please note that the location for this role is Gothenburg, Sweden.
What Will You Do?* Developing Golang based cloud software to manage Ericsson Private 5G networks.
* Implement and verify technical solutions based upon Ericsson and 3PP (Third Party Product) products
* Work on the existing code base as well as new feature development within a cross-functional team
* Contribute to design of system architecture
* Contribute to an innovative culture/environment


Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:* Four to six (4-6) years of development experience
* Senior Golang (or Java/C/C++) expertise
* High communication and collaboration skills
* Good understanding of agile development methodologies
* Good knowledge of: SQL, RESTful APIs, Kubernetes (or Docker)
* Good knowledge and experience working with Gitlab (or similar code repository services based on GIT)
* Experience with Jira/Confluence (or similarly issue tracking tools)
* Experience with testing practices and continuous integration


Preferred Qualifications:* University degree of Bachelor or Master
* Team player capabilities with an extraordinary "can do" attitude and positive approach
* Thrives in a dynamic work environment
* Enterprise IT and/or Telecom experience
* Good knowledge of: Linux, Scripting, Cloud platform (Google Cloud, AWS or Azure), TCP/IP


#LI-Remote
Why Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions?
At Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions, we are one team - all in on inclusion. Celebrating the uniqueness of our individual team members across the globe helps us build diverse teams where we all can thrive. Our connected, community-focused culture enables each one of us to perform at our best and fully be ourselves.  

Our values drive everything we do:* Respect: we don't point a finger; we lend a hand.
* Integrity: we do the right thing, even when it is hard; we make fact-based decisions.
* Perseverance: we accept and embrace change; we have a passion to win!
* Professionalism: we hold each other accountable.


We are creating the future of global connectivity and community. Come join us. You belong here.
Compensation & Benefits at Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions
At Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions, we know that our people are the key to our success. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package to help with your individual needs and goals.  

Your Pay:
Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions offers a competitive salary with a focus on a global market. For many roles, the compensation package includes annual and incremental incentive plans; certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply. The actual salary offered is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, the candidate’s combination of job-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience.  

Your Health:
Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions offers excellent, competitive employee benefits. Our global team members are eligible to participate in customary health and other benefit plans and programs based on location.  

Your Financial Security:
Where available, Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions offers an employee retirement plan.  

Your Time:
Your work-life balance is important to us. Where locally applicable, Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions provides generous paid time off, including: Flexible Time Off (FTO), four paid quarterly well-being days, and a Global Holiday schedule. Certain pro-ration rules apply to some time off benefits.  

Additional Benefits:
Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions offers other company-paid benefits such as a comprehensive International Employee Assistance Program, No Internal Meeting Fridays, and volunteer paid time off. *Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions’ Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging mission is to create an inclusive work environment where all employees’ differences are celebrated, their thoughts matter, and everyone feels safe to bring their authentic selves to work. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and aim to attract, develop, and engage top talent from a diverse candidate pool. It is our policy and commitment to provide equal opportunity employment for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.*
Please note: Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Ericsson Enterprise Wireless Solutions employees.
