title: Drill and Blast Engineer to Aitik
description:
Boliden is a high-tech metal company with its own mines and smelters, committed to ensuring society’s supply of base and precious metals while striving to be the world’s most climate-friendly and respected metal provider. Our work has been integral to the value chains that have shaped modern society for a century. The metals we mine and produce will play a crucial role in the future – it is how we produce them that matters. Join us in driving change for generations to come.
Your opportunity
Do you want to have the opportunity to grow and develop in our company and be a part of Boliden´s journey? The Mine Technical Service is now searching for a Drill and blast Engineer with location Aitik.
The Mining Technology section is responsible for Aitik's mine planning, mine maps, geology and production-related technology and development issues. We work to create conditions for efficient production and the work is carried out in close collaboration with other sections and departments. The section consists of teams specialized in Geology, Mine surveying, Mine planning, Drill and blast technology, Geotechnology and Geohydrology and Production technology.
Description
As a Drill and Blast Engineer, you will be part of the team responsible for planning and optimizing drilling and blasting operations. In this role, you will work on planning and act as an expert on issues and decisions related to drilling, charging, and blasting. You will also be involved in the follow-up and development of drilling and blasting activities to optimize fragmentation and costs. Additionally, you will handle safety-related matters in the field, such as conducting risk assessments and investigations. You will provide support to supervisors and blasting crew in production regarding drilling and blasting questions.
Areas of responsibility:* Develop drilling, charging and blasting designs
* Update blasting maps and plan for evacuation during blasting
* Follow-up and manage explosive inventory and initiate purchases when needed
* Assist with mine planning, drill and blast and scheduling to meet the operational targets
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including geologists, mining engineers, and production crews to optimize blasting performance and achieve production targets.
* Monitor and analyze blast result, implementing improvements to enhance efficiency and productivity
* Provide technical expertise and support to operational teams
* Reporting of drill and blast QAQC activities
* Coordinate and contact with contractors/suppliers of drilling equipment and explosives


What you bring:
As a person you are open, result oriented and communicative. You are structured, thorough and have good collaborative skills. You like to work independently as well as in a team and want to participate in developing ways of working and optimizing production. You have Mining engineering education or as the company sees as equivalent and minimum 5 years’ experience in the mining industry, specifically working as a Drill and Blast Engineer in open pit mining operations. Previous experience in using Deswik or equivalent for mine design and scheduling software is meritorious and electronic detonator experience is an advantage. You should be able to express yourself well in both spoken and written English. If you are proficient in Swedish that is a merit. Category B driving license is a requirement.
Why work with us:
At Boliden, we believe in creating a workplace where care, courage, and responsibility guide everything we do. We offer a supportive and collaborative environment and if you are passionate about making a difference and ready to take on a role that offers both challenge and growth, we would like to hear from you.
Apply before 10th of November 2024 to be part of something truly meaningful!
Send in your application with CV via the application icon "Apply" in the advertisement on our website www.boliden.com – Career – Vacancies. Selection will be ongoing, so we are looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible and the position may be filled before the application deadline.
Do you want to know more about the position? Please contact Drill and Blast Manager Emre Terzi +46 70 912 17 33 or emre.terzi@boliden.com
Questions regarding your application are answered by Talent Acquisition Partner Jessica Grönwall via mail to jessica.gronwall@ext.boliden.com
Union information is available from;* Ledarna ledarna.aitik@boliden.com
* Unionen unionen.aitik@boliden.com
* SACO saco.aitik@boliden.com

*If you are a representative of a recruiting firm, please refrain from contacting us about this posting. We appreciate your consideration.*
-
Important! If you are a current employee within Boliden you shouldn't complete the application at this site, please log on to your Workday account and apply through "Find Jobs".

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

**Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

**Application**

title: Engineering Graduate Program - R&D Automation Engineer
description:
**Engineering Graduate Program – Automation Engineer**


Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey that will kick-start your career and empower you to have a real impact in transforming human health worldwide? With a rich heritage dating back hundreds of years, our wealth of technical expertise and talent, a broad and deep portfolio, and exceptional service help researchers and biopharma advance therapeutics at every stage from discovery to delivery. At Cytiva, our mission is to advance and accelerate therapeutics. Our vision is a world in which access to life-changing therapies transforms human health.


We are currently seeking passionate and ambitious talents to join our **Engineering Graduate Program** in Uppsala, starting January 2025. The Engineering Graduate Program is divided into different engineering profiles. Together with us, you will be at the forefront of enabling our customers in the development, manufacturing, and delivery of transformative medicines to patients. As an Engineering Graduate at Cytiva, you will benefit from:

* Strong support to develop and accelerate your technical knowledge and expertise together with a team of young professionals.
* Opportunities for cross-functional project work, site visits, and internal training sessions to learn about Cytiva’s core technologies and business.

* Enthusiastic and eager to learn and grow within the Life Science engineering field.

title: Parts Planner/Logistics Engineer - Gothenburg
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
We are looking for a Logistics Engineer for our client in the automotive industry.
  
  

You have the opportunity to play a significant role in developing cutting-edge luxury vehicles for our client’s next generation. Working alongside a global team of engineers, you will help pioneer advanced car technologies focused on enhancing the human experience, simplifying life, and increasing enjoyment for individuals. If you have a passion for design, connected car technology, and a commitment to improving the lives of others and the environment while creating exceptional driving experiences, then this is the ideal environment for you to thrive.
  
  

Infotainment is one of the fastest growing areas within automotive today. Competition is no longer confined to traditional automotive rivals, as companies such as Apple and Google are also playing a significant role. The client has effectively introduced advanced driver interaction and infotainment systems and is dedicated to maintaining its success through ongoing innovation.
  
  

The team is tasked with creating, constructing, and upkeeping test items utilized by all department teams. This includes subsystem rigs, automated HIL rigs, and vehicles. Your main role in the team will involve managing orders and materials for building and maintaining software test items for connected experiences, like new hardware versions of car ECUs and wire harnesses for bench rigs. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other departments and suppliers to stay informed and updated.
  
  

Job Assignments
  
  

This position requires driving to deliver and manage materials for testing items throughout a large company, as well as analyzing its effects on the development process.
  
  

* Receiving and placing orders (SRM/POB/TOCC)
* Communicating with suppliers

title: Senior RF-ingenjör
description:
Är din passion radiofrekvensteknik (RF) och söker du en ledarroll i ett dynamiskt och innovativt företag? Tycker du om att arbeta med tvärfunktionella projekt inom en växande och viktig bransch? Om du trivs med tekniska utmaningar och vill vara en del av ett team som driver utvecklingen inom RF-teknik framåt, kan detta vara din nästa möjlighet.


Vi söker en Senior RF-ingenjör som ska ta ansvar för den tekniska utvecklingen, från koncept till implementering, i vårt tvärfunktionella ingenjörsteam. Du kommer att leda hela livscykeln för systemutveckling – från kravdefinition och funktionsanalys till systemverifiering, validering och fälttester. Du kommer också att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av Software Defined Radio (SDR) och integrera teknik i framkant för att förbättra flexibiliteten och funktionaliteten i våra RF-lösningar. Intresserad? Ansök idag!

**Om rollen:**


Som Senior RF-ingenjör kommer du att vara en integrerad del av vårt ingenjörsteam, med fokus på att utveckla och integrera RF-system. Du kommer att samarbeta med interna avdelningar och externa kunder för att säkerställa systemframgång, samt bidra till design, testning och distribution av toppmoderna RF-lösningar, inklusive SDR-teknik. Din roll innefattar även att leda den tekniska utvecklingsprocessen, stödja systemverifiering och fälttester för att säkerställa framgångsrik projektgenomföring.

**Ansvarsområden:**

* Planera och hantera den tekniska utvecklingsprocessen för RF- och SDR-system.
* Genomföra kravdefinitioner, allokeringar och funktionsanalyser för att säkerställa att systemspecifikationerna uppfylls.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteamet för att designa och implementera SDR-lösningar.
* Arbeta med verifieringsingenjörer för att utföra systemverifiering och validering, och säkerställa att systemen uppfyller de nödvändiga standarderna.
* Ge stöd till testingenjörer under systemtestning och valideringsfaser.
* Stödja fälttester och säkerställa att RF-system, inklusive SDR, fungerar som förväntat i verkliga miljöer.
* Socialt utåtriktad, kommunikativ och förmåga att samarbeta med olika avdelningar.
* Leda designgranskningar och säkerställa att RF-system följer relevanta standarder och krav.
* Delta i integrationen av RF-system i toppmoderna kommandosystem och kommunikationssystem.

**För att lyckas i rollen:**

* Examen inom elektroteknik, RF-teknik, telekommunikation, inbyggda system eller ett relaterat område.
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med RF- och SDR-system.
* Fördjupad förståelse för RF-systemdesign, testning och verifieringsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera tvärfunktionella ingenjörsprojekt, från design till implementering.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal & skrift.
* Förmåga att bygga starka relationer och samarbeten internt och med externa intressenter.
* Skicklig på att lösa komplexa problem och trivs i en snabbföränderlig arbetsmiljö.

 **Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av försvarssystem eller liknande högt reglerade branscher.
* Kunskap om C4I-system, radiosystem och/eller nätverk.
* Erfarenhet av att leda FoU-projekt eller komplexa ingenjörsteam.

**Som person:**


Du är självgående, proaktiv och drivs av att leverera resultat. Du har starka kommunikations- och ledarskapsfärdigheter som gör att du kan inspirera och påverka andra. Du anpassar dig enkelt till förändringar och brinner för att utveckla personer och team. Hos oss kommer du att vara en del av en dynamisk och flexibel miljö där du kan göra verklig skillnad.

**Ansökan:**


Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, eftersom urval och intervjuer sker löpande. För frågor om rollen, kontakta Andreas Beckman på andreas.beckman@elbitsystems.se.

**Om oss:**


Elbit Systems Sweden är en del av ett världsledande internationellt teknikföretag, specialiserat inom försvar och säkerhet. Våra produkter och system används över hela världen, inom luft-, land-, sjö- och cybermiljöer. I Sverige har vi etablerat oss som en nyckelspelare och erbjuder avancerade lösningar inom militär kommunikation, lednings- och kontrollsystem. Vi är stolta över att kunna erbjuda en portfölj som inkluderar allt från HF-radio till satellit- och IP/WAN-nätverk, vilket säkerställer säker och pålitlig dataöverföring, oavsett tillämpning. Som ett säkerhetsföretag genomför vi säkerhetskontroller på alla anställda, och svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.

title: Test Engineer
description:
**Role:**  

As a Test Engineer you will be responsible for designing, implementing and executing test cases to validate the functionality and performance of software components. You will collaborate with software developers, system architects, and other testers to ensure the reliability and robustness of the system.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* Experience with test case design, test script development, and test automation.
* Hands-on experience with system-level integration and end-to-end validation
* Experience with test automation frameworks and tools (e.g., Python, Robot Framework, Jenkins).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and continuous testing.


Valid European driver’s license B is must because


Degree in computer science or electrical engineering preferred.  

  

**Meritorious:**

  

* C++ experience, big plus
* Knowledge of automotive operating systems (e.g., AUTOSAR, QNX, Linux).
* Familiarity with diagnostic protocols (e.g., UDS, OBD-II) and data logging tools.
* Hands-on experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) or software-in-the-loop (SIL) testing environments.

title: Radio Functional System Engineer
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Would you like to be part of the key product development area for Ericsson?


Do you like to turn ideas into concrete solutions?


We are looking for a colleague that would like to work with us in the development of new radio products in a creative environment!

  

You will belong to a small team with long experience in Radio products with an excellent collaboration and supportive attitude. We are responsible for functions in the radio that covers measurement, supervision and converting digital data into the RF domain and vice versa.  

Examples of technical areas are Control Algorithms, Passive Intermodulation Cancellation and Antenna Calibration. We collaborate with engineers, experts, and specialist both in the radio organization as in baseband and ASIC development. Currently we are developing radios for 5G and are involved in studies for 6G.

 **What you will do:**

* Drive the development of new radio functions and improve and adapt existing radio functions for new radio products.
* Contribute to technical studies.
* Contribute to meet future technical challenges and contribute to improvements.

 **The skills you bring:**

* You are interested in understanding how it all fits together to ensure an overall good solution.
* You are motivated to be part of the journey to bring an idea on paper into a final solution in the product.
* You are self-motivated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* You have good communication skills and can express yourself both verbally and in written text.

  

Key Qualifications  

* Education: M.Sc. or PhD in electrical engineering, embedded software, applied physics or equivalent.
* Domain experience: embedded systems and embedded software
* Min years of work experience: 7
* Min years of system work experience: 1
* Working experience in software development
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Electronic Design Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Sigma Connectivity is an internationally recognized technology design house that provides customers with everything they need to bring new products to life. We're expanding our electronic design capabilities with a new high-profile role designing and testing electronics for customer projects, meeting with customers, helping to grow the team, and of course having fun while doing it!



**The role:**



We’re looking for an experienced Electronic Design Engineer with a good understanding of hardware development. If you have expertise designing hardware —and have the ability understand and interpret customer needs to transform them into manufacturable designs, then we would like to hear from you!


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



We're ideally looking for the following qualifications:


* 5+ years of electrical design and eCAD experience.
* Experience with the product development process, from brain-storming concepts to manufacturing and delivering real products
* Good at communicating complex things in a simple way.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Soft skills we’re looking for


* A team-oriented person with good people skills
* Open-minded and interested in learning new technologies
* Ability to energize yourself and the people around you
* Comfortable interacting with customers
* Passion for people, great design, and making the world a better place


Preferred additional skills, personal traits, experience


* Experience working with wireless connected “smart” products using connectivity standards such as Bluetooth, WiFi, NFC, LTE
* Able to design and test for good EMC performance
* Experience with low current microcontroller solutions
* Battery and charging design solutions
* Discrete design for analog electronics
* Understanding of how to write test specifications from project requirements

### **WE OFFER**


* A diverse international work environment
* Opportunities to develop cutting-edge technology for leading brands all over the world
* Extensive hardware and software expertise, with all of the facilities and tools to build and test new products and solutions from end-to-end
* The opportunity to work on a variety of projects, promoting individual development
* Occasional opportunities to work on-site or embedded with customer teams
* The Sigma Connectivity company culture.
* Being part of a wonderful and highly engaged team where you will never work alone.


**About us**



Sigma Connectivity is a world-class technology and design house. We partner with leading consumer and technology brands to transform their visions into reality. Our in-house and external consulting teams provide the expertise to translate our customers’ ideas into advanced connected products and solutions that can communicate in the Internet of Things (IoT).



As a member of the Sigma Connectivity team, you'll help create cutting-edge products used by consumers around the world. Innovation is in our DNA, and we draw from our expertise in a wide range of areas to rapidly design, build and deploy smart connected devices and experiences. Our Connectivity culture is all about sharing our knowledge and experience to deliver tomorrow’s products and solutions today.



We strive to foster a creative work environment where all people are valued as individuals, while working together creatively as a team, collaborating and challenging ourselves to continually grow within our roles. Today, we have over 500 dedicated colleagues around the world, so our differences are embraced and valued as competitive advantages that allow us to respond to new needs with innovation that produces high quality results.



*“We share a vision of a better tomorrow where everything is connected. Where people, machines and the environment can grow and live together in interdependent harmony. Some call this the Internet of Things, but for us it’s just the foundation of everything that we do.”* *- Björn Lundqvist, CEO*



### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact


* #### **POSITION**


Electronic Design Engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Connectivity Engineering
* #### **LOCATION**


Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Industrial Design & Ergonomics, Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, System design, System development, Project Management
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-09-26
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2024-10-11
* #### **CONTACT**


Susanne Wieslander, susanne.wieslander@sigma.se, +46704449787

title: Systems Engineer, People Planning
description:
**Job ID:** 261350


**Date posted:** 09/10/2024


**Our team within IKEA**  

  

Here at IKEA, we are looking to hire passionate engineers, excited about technology and innovative ways of working to shape the future of IKEA. In People Planning you will be part of a team that operates continuously develops our solutions used in 20+ countries as well as implement solutions for new countries. With several solutions; it requires the team to develop country specific APIs to our library in order to fulfil our decoupled architecture, thus we safeguard the standard and parameterization for the new landscape.  

  

**Who you are**  

  

You have a passion for technology, you welcome change and you love to learn. As a person you are innovative and work towards putting modern architecture and requirements into place. You are aware of and appreciate IKEAs corporate identity, core values and vision of creating a better everyday life for the many people. In People Planning you will be part of a team that operates continuously develops our solutions used in 20+ countries as well as implement solutions for new countries.  

  

**About this work area**  

  

A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US
  

  

As a System Engineer you will be part of a team that designs, builds and supports the products in our domain. We deploy solutions to implement essential people planning capabilities for countries, where systems engineers will ensure that capability fulfills business requirements regardless the vendor/partner involved.
  

  

You will:
  

  

* Be part of the iterative design process with the team
* Work together with our SaaS providers and define a solution design between Ingka and vendor responsible together with our integration team.
* Configure vendor solution according to Ingka specific requirements
* Create custom reports
* Support and partly build extensions to vendor solution based on unique IKEA requirements
* Make sure our documentation and specifications is always up to date
* Support the products we develop in production

  

In this role you will report to the Engineering Manager.  

  

  

  

  

ABOUT THIS WORK AREA
  

  

In People Domain we work with several different solutions supporting the many co-workers at IKEA with products to make their day to day life easier. One of this areas are People Planning where we work with Schedule and Time keeping solutions for the co-workers.
  

  

In People Planning sub-domain we want to be able to build and configure our products as independently as possible to deliver fast outcome to our end-users. Since our product landscape contains external solutions, we need to empower our team with this specific skills and experience of different vendor solutions
  

  

To succeed in the role, we see that you have:
  

  

* Good experience from various implementations of vendors like UKG Workforce Dimensions, Kronos Workforce Central, ATOSS, aTurnos. Ideally as a technical role worked with Timekeeping accruals Advance scheduling etc.
* Knowledge and experience with integration of HR / Workforce Management solutions, like ADP and SAP SuccessFactors EC
* Good experience of integrations work, to and from vendor solutions with Data translation and API mappings
* Good Experience creating custom reports from vendor data.
* Good experience of working in agile software development teams with an emphasis on self-organization
* Experience of building extensions of vendors
* Understanding of API design. API 1st mindset, REST API design
* Understanding of event-based architecture

  

The IKEA culture and values are naturally integrated in our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.  

  

  

  

WORDS FROM THE MANAGER!
  

  

What inspires me and is the reason for loving my job at IKEA?
  

  

I would say it’s many things, first of all it’s a company with fantastic values and we are really using our values as a guiding star in everything we do.
   

  

But if we go into specifics what me (and hopefully you) can do to make a difference? One example is how we are set-up in our team. We as a team have the accountability of our product end to end, if we make a mistake that is fine. But it’s also us as a team that needs to solve the mistake and learn from it. To be able to take on this accountability we need to have a team with different personality and core skills in the Engineering sector. This is what inspire me, that one individual cannot solve everything, but as a team we can do magic!  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

The role is based in Helsingborg and you will report to an Engineering Manager.
  

  

For more information about the role, please apply via this website.

 Questions about this recruitment process can be answered by Lead TA Partner - Nidhi Illman via nidhi.illman@hm.com
   

  

 Please stick to applying only via our SmartRecruiters system as due to GDPR, we dont accept applications via LinkedIn message or emails.

title: Software Development Intern
description:
**About Us**
 Talendary is a Stockholm-based company revolutionising the recruitment process through AI-powered solutions. Our mission is to enhance and simplify recruitment for both recruiters and employers by automating tasks like candidate screening, ensuring efficiency and bias-free hiring decisions. Talendary's AI technology identifies top-tier candidates effortlessly, enabling recruiters to focus on meaningful human connections and strategic decisions. Learn more about us at (http://www.talendary.com).
   

  

**Position:** 
 Software Development Intern
   

  

**Location:** 
 Hybrid (Remote and Stockholm - Sundbyberg Office)
   

  

**Duration:** 
 4-6 months internship, with potential for full-time employment upon successful completion.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work on projects involving AI and machine learning.
* Collaborate with a skilled team to develop and implement software solutions.
* Gain hands-on experience in frontend, backend, or fullstack development, depending on your expertise.


**What We Offer**
* A 100% time commitment (negotiable).
* Hands-on learning in the world of AI and machine learning.
* A flexible, hybrid working model
* Opportunity for full-time employment after the internship.

title: Frontend developer to big bank in Stockholm!
Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!
   

  

**About The Role**
 At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.
   

  

**To Do This We’ll Expect You To**
* Build and maintain models and services and deploy them
* Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency
* Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems
* Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals
* Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards


**To Succeed In This Role You Probably**
* Love writing high-quality production-grade code
* Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment
* Experience in building and deploying machine learning models
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools
* You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you


 If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. title: Integration Engineer
description:
***Integration Engineer***




  





**Application Deadline:** 
 Nov. 30, 2024
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



  





 We are seeking an experienced and dynamic integration engineer to strengthen our integration team.
 



  





 Simployer/AlexisHR is expanding its integration capabilities by offering integration solutions to our customers, seamlessly connecting with their existing IT ecosystems, which often include third-party systems such as recruiting software (ATS), CRM, Payroll, and IdP solutions.
 



  





 Our dedicated integration team, supported by a robust platform built on Apache Camel, is at the forefront of these efforts.
 



  





 As an integration engineer, you will advance our integration capabilities in a central team. You will have a direct impact on how we connect systems by implementing new integration requirements and standardizing existing ones while promoting a self-service approach to building integrations.
 



  





**What you will do:** 



* Collaborate with the integration team on all activities related to integrating software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet both organizational and customer business requirements.
* Implement and maintain robust integration solutions to facilitate scalable and secure connections with external systems.
* Contribute to the development of the integration target architecture strategy.
* Assist in building an ecosystem of partners and "standard" integrations that connect to our data & onboarding APIs.
* Ensure successful customer adoption of our solutions, connecting them to their other commercial software applications.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders in product & technology teams, sales departments, and customer organizations.
* Provide technical expertise to product teams on the use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, and best practices.



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What you will bring to the team:** 



* A solid technical understanding of APIs, Distributed systems, Event sourcing, and integrations gained through experience working as a developer or integration engineer with some level of customer contact.
* Proficiency in building scalable integration services, preferably with systems such as ERP and/or Payroll.
* Fluency in at least one OOP language such as Java, Kotlin, or C#.
* Experience working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with Integration Systems such as Apache Camel, Jboss Fuse, WSO2, or Azure Logic Apps
* Attention to detail and the ability to implement stable and scalable integrations
* Strong analytical abilities and great communication skills



  





**What we see as a plus:** 



* Experience in the identity & access management area
* Experience in the HRIS domain (HR master data, HR systems, Payroll data and Employee & Organizational data)



  





**Our main tech stack:** 




 Java, C#, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Apache Camel, Docker, AWS, .Net Core, JavaScript, REACT, MS SQL, Rabbit MQ, Event Hub, Azure, Kubernetes, Containers, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Octopus, TeamCity, Azure.
 



  





**Message from the Hiring Manager:** 




 I'm Michał, and I serve as the Engineering Manager for the Connectivity team. I've been with Simployer for over 6 years, and it's only getting more interesting as time goes on. Our team's responsibilities include:
 


* Providing integration solutions to third parties, such as payroll systems.
* Offering advisory services for internal integration architecture.
* Managing responsibilities within the back-office platform.



  





**When you work with us, you can count on:** 



* Great conversations about how to solve things (without drowning in endless meetings).
* A super supportive team that’s always ready to help—and maybe share a coffee or two.
* A fun ride as we tackle challenges together, because work should be enjoyable, right?



  





 We’re all about keeping things easy-going and productive, with a few laughs along the way!
 



  





**Our Hiring Process** 



* **HR Screening:** 
 A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about you and your background (approx. 15 minutes).
* **Meeting with Michał** 
 : A technical screening and a friendly introduction to get to know each other (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Personality and Logic Test** 
 : A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs.
* **Technical Interview** 
 : You'll meet with Michal again together with other Tech leaders for a more in-depth technical discussion and to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).
* **Informal HR Interview** 
 : Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides.



  





**We can’t wait to meet you!** 




 At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Hilda Westin
 



 hilda.westin@simployer.com
 



 +46736590380

title: Service Engineer

description:
We now have the opportunity for you to be a service engineer for machine vision in the Scandinavian team.
   

  

 A service engineer at Valmet works with products that has the reputation of being the market leader, and having the most advanced product portfolio for pulp and paper automation.
   

  

 Valmet IQ Machine vision (web inspection/monitoring systems) helps detect quality defects and identify their root causes. In this job you are one of our customers' important contacts, and you will handle service cases from the very beginning until the case is closed with a satisfied customer. During all phases of the case you are supported by technical experts.
   

  

 We are looking for a technically oriented, communicative person willing to cooperate within the Scandinavian team.
   

  

**Position**
* Service Engineer, Machine Vision
* Customer satisfaction and relations
* Organize, execute, and report your own service visits
* Predictive maintenance, tuning of the systems, classification of defects etc.
* Participate in new delivery projects, system extensions and upgrade projects
* Remote support from the office
* Collaborative work with the Product Line in Tampere, Finland, and the global Operations Network
* The position is based in Karlstad, but Gothenburg, Sundsvall or Stockholm could also be possible locations, depending on where you live.


**Qualifications**
* Relevant engineering degree
* Experience from machine vision systems is an advantage
* Significant part of the career in Pulp & Paper industry (process skills)
* Self-starter, open for collaboration with colleagues and customers
* Ability to act and make decisions
* Organized, with an ability to prioritize whilst multi-tasking
* Fluent in English and Swedish
* Driving license class B and willingness to travel within Scandinavia


**We offer**
 We offer you diverse tasks in a truly international environment and the opportunity to develop and grow with Valmet. In this role, you will be able to work with the latest automation technology and the opportunity to help our customers succeed. You are part of a professional team that values your work and supports your development, starting with a solid onboarding plan.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 For more information about the position, you are welcome to contact Roger Holmedahl, Country Manager at +46 54 170 014.
   

  

 We will be working with continuous selection for this position, so please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than November 3rd.
   

  

***When everything works together***
*Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With over 19,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries, and serve an even wider base of process industries with our automation systems and flow control solutions. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.*
*Join the team!* 
 www.valmet.com/careers

title: Field Service Engineer Finland
description:
**You may be our new** 




  





**Field Service Engineer Finland** 








  





 As our business continues to expand, we are seeking additional
 **Field Service Engineers** 
 to join our team. In this role, you will engage directly with customers, working on SIG’s filling lines and handling a variety of technical tasks. Your work will primarily take place at our customers’ production facilities, while your home will serve as your base location. Our customers are based in
 **Jalasjärvi, Kuopio, and southern Finland.**




  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Install, commission, and repair filling and packaging machines and technical upgrades
* Support customers (start-up, operation, maintenance, etc.) of the filling lines
* Carry out routine scheduled maintenance work and responding to equipment faults
* Troubleshooting including root cause analysis; diagnose breakdown problems and analyze malfunctions
* Document, installation, inspections, and maintenance service work
* Advise management regarding customer satisfaction, product performance, customer requests, and suggestions for improvements
* Report customer satisfaction, product performance, and suggestions for improvements
* Comply with company health, safety, and environmental policies



  





  





**You Bring These Skills, Experience & Education** 




  




* Experience preferably in beverage/food/packaging industries
* Experience in troubleshooting
* Good basic knowledge in the field of mechanical and electrical engineering
* Basics in automation and control technology (e.g. PLC) are seen as an advantage
* Thrive to give excellent service to our customers
* Place of residence: home office with proximity to the airport
* Willing to mobile work and travel up to 100%
* Good written and spoken English as well as one native Nordic language (Danish, Swedish, Finnish)
* Driving licence is a must



  





  





**SIG competencies** 




  





 We are looking for people who are willing to consistently achieve results, even under tough circumstances, employees who create a climate where everyone is motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives. If you actively seek new ways to grow and be challenged, if you develop people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals, SIG is the place for you. To deliver better for our customers, our future colleagues build strong customer relationships and deliver customer-centric solutions. Finally, we are looking for colleagues who build partnerships and work collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. Are you someone who applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization’s goals? Are you someone who can create new and better ways for the organization to be successful? If the answer is ‘yes’, come and join us.
 



  





  





**Our promise** 




  





 SIG is the place for you to build something incredible. We offer competitive compensation and an opportunity to partially work from home. If you join us, you will be part of a globally successful international company, which is leading its industry in sustainability, technology, and more. We think of ourselves as the career launchpad - a place to develop yourself fast with real work, real experience, real opportunities to build skills. You will be part of a highly motivated and dynamic team, you will have personal development opportunities, trainings and coaching opportunities from senior team members. If you show skill and willingness to learn, we'll back you all the way.
 



  





  





**About SIG** 




  





 SIG is a leading provider of packaging systems and solutions for better. We work in partnership with our customers to bring food products to consumers around the world in a safe, sustainable, and affordable way. We are the only packaging system supplier covering carton, pouch, and bag-in-box. Our versatile technology and product innovation capacity enable us to deliver better for customers, for consumers, and for the world. Sustainability guides us, technology empowers us, but it’s the passion and drive of our people that truly enable us to deliver better. Founded in 1853, SIG is headquartered in Neuhausen, Switzerland, and listed at the SIX Swiss Exchange.
 



  





  





 Contact
 



 SIG Recruiting Team
 



 Phone: +49 246 279 1436
 



 Email: recruiting@sig.biz

title: Lead Frontend Engineer at global leader in media delivery
description:
**Net Insights Sync team, working on precise networked time synchronization, needs reinforcement if you're a Frontend Engineer with a hunger for a challenge - Keep reading!**
**OFFER**
 Net Insight offers the possibility to work hands-on with cutting-edge technology and products used by millions. Together in a close-knit team with colleagues who share a passion for delivering top-quality products, you have the chance to enable reliable live experiences for a global and diverse audience.
   

  

 The teams are cross-functional and there will be opportunities to move between the teams. They empower individuals and teams and encourage open communication/collaboration across teams.
   

  

**Some Of The Benefits Of Working At Net Insight**
* An open and flat organization with a lot of teamwork
* Run a very technologically advanced environment
* A family-friendly company, with an understanding of the necessity of a healthy work/life balance
* Every employee is valuable and can drive changes and influence the product as well as WoW.
* Unusually low turnover – High employee satisfaction


**THE TEAM HIRING**
 You will be part of the Sync team, a team working on a new product that focuses on their algorithm for time synchronization. It is about using different time sources (atomic clock, PPS, GNSS, measurement of round-trip times in the network) to be able to calculate the time at the nanosecond level in their nodes.
   

  

*WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?*
 Apart from the fact that you will be joining a team focused on innovation and in new areas you probably haven’t discovered yet you would be the only frontend developer in the team. Meaning you are taking the lead on all aspects of the frontend development lifecycle, including requirements, design, architecture, deployment, etc. Given this, you will be granted a lot of freedom to shape the future of the front-end area in this team, and your contribution will significantly impact the product.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 We are looking for someone that has a few years of experience as a full-stack or frontend developer, preferably focused on the latter which is an area where you’re passionate and skilled. You are comfortable in a role making quick decisions with a creative and experimental approach.
   

  

 You will be working with skilled engineers who are open to learning new things and value working in a team to achieve a common goal. Therefore, you should have great communication and organizational skills.
   

  

 Seen to the technical elements of the role, you need to have:
   

  

* Be fluent in TypeScript/JavaScript
* Experience with React or similar (e.g Angular)
* Experience with Material UI or Similar (e.g Bootstrap)
* Experience with Unit tests (e.g. Jest or similar)


**Extra Bonus If You Have Some Experience With**
* Node.Js
* Grafana
* Docker/K8s
* Visualizing large networks with d3js, Sigma.Js or similar
* UI-testing with e.f Selenium or Cypress


**About Net Insight**
 Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) is a global leader in media networks, resource optimization, and streaming solutions. With more than 25 years of experience, Net Insight is a trusted and important partner and a leading force in the media tech industry in creating a better media experience. More than 500 world-class customers run mission-critical media services using Net Insight’s solutions in more than 60 countries worldwide.
   

  

 With their extensive experience in the professional media industry, the world’s leading media providers have relied on Net insight’s Emmy®-winning Nimbra solution to guarantee their media transport and accurately synchronize TV and media services over existing IP networks independently of GNSS/GPS. Net Insight now brings this uniquely established knowledge into the future mobile networks to solve 5G TDD time synchronization independent of GNSS/GPS by approaching it as an open disaggregated virtualized end-to-end service provided independent of the underlying network is for Net Insight the only future-proof approach.
   

  

 For more info, visit https://netinsight.net/
   

  

  

  

**About Pinetree**
 At Pinetree, we have a vision and mission to differentiate ourselves from the crowd and are Sweden's contenders in talent search and matching. By working as an agency, the value to you as an employee is that we have an extensive network of partner companies that we continuously ensure high-quality standards.
   

  

**This recruitment is direct employment at Net Insight AB and all applications, questions, and administration of the recruitment process are managed by Pinetree AB.**

title: Enterprise Architect SW
description:
**Software Architect**
 DeLaval’s leading position in the market is based on innovations and our ability to bring a constant flow of relevant new exciting products and services to our customers.
   

  

**Do you want to be a part of this journey?**
 As an Enterprise level Software Architect, you translate business needs and ambitions into concrete, robust and appropriate solution architectures.
   

  

 You are part of the Architecture and Requirements team within Systems Engineering. This is a small team with big possibilities to influence the product development of DeLaval. The team provides highest knowledge of our solutions and up to date technologies of the industry.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop vision and strategy for realizing system features and how products should work together in a system (Hardware and Software Platform ownership)
* Architectural preparation of Product Owner initiatives to make sure that they are aligned with the DeLaval overall technical strategy
* Support overall portfolio planning with detailed knowledge about architectural dependencies, limitations, and options according to architectural strategy
* Drive definition and maintenance of architecture in alignment with Product Owners and Supply Chain, meeting organization and business needs


**Qualifications And Experience**
* Master of Science university degree (technical faculty or similar)
* Ideally, about 5 years of experience in working with product development and software system architecture
* Understanding Distributed systems, IoT devices, communication links and embedded systems
* Holistic view on product development for cost effective performance, installation, troubleshooting and configuration
* Broad knowledge of architecture design to make SW development and maintenance efficient


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.
* Bonus program
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**A**
**Additional Information**
 The position report to the Manager of Architecture and Requirements in Systems Engineering, Product Development. This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace. Travelling a few times per year will be required.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**C**
**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Andreas Papp, andreas.papp@delaval.com
   

  

 HR Business Partner: Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at  corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior Researcher – AI / Machine Learning and Networking
description:
*Do you want to develop future smart networks based on AI together with us? Do you have a passion for smart networks and are able to design and develop future networks and network management solutions making use of AI/ML technology? Then you might be the person we are looking for!*
 Our research unit, Connected Intelligence is located in RISE offices in Kista and is a part of RISE Computer Science department. We engage in research projects with high academic quality at both international and national level. Some of our projects are also in close collaboration with industry. The Connected Intelligence unit focuses on networked and connected systems from IoT and embedded systems to smart networks - 5G/6G and beyond. As a researcher in our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a growing research team with great development opportunities. You become an important team player in a committed team with high competence and will be able to collaborate both within the team and with other departments at RISE as well as our external partners. Our unit have strong relations with academia including KTH and Uppsala University.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In your role as a researcher in AI/ML based smart networks, you will mainly work in Kista. Our projects have great variety but are focused on AI-based cybersecurity, wireless 5G and 6G networks, edge AI and network management. In your role you are also in touch with our project partners, and we believe that you look forward to being a leading researcher and expert in the projects. Your most important tasks are to:
   

  

* Lead and participate in cutting-edge research projects
* Participate in defining research activities
* Work on high-quality research proposals with internal and external partners
* Publish high-quality research results in leading publication venues
* Supervise students both at PhD and MSc level


 The position is initially over 12 months with a good chance to extend to permanent after that.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As a researcher in our team, we believe that you are a solution-oriented person driven by taking on new challenges. Since the role involves regular contact with project partners and other stakeholders, we believe that you enjoy social contexts and are service-oriented. Through your structured and independent way of working, you come to your right in a dynamic research environment.
   

  

 You have experience in leading and participating in research projects in the area of artificial intelligence or networking and ideally in the intersection of the two. You have a track record in acquiring project grants at both national and international level. You have participated in leading roles in international or national projects.
   

  

 You have relevant postgraduate education from university or equivalent, preferably with a focus on networking, artificial intelligence/machine learning. It is a merit if you have experience in development in C or C++ for network systems and experience with Linux or similar operating systems. Since our partners are both in Sweden and outside Sweden, we see that you have a good ability to express yourself in speech and writing in English.
   

  

**Are we right for each other?**
 Our research unit, Connected Intelligence, is growing and we want to expand our team in Kista. That's why we're looking for a researcher with a keen interest in both research and practical application of next generation AI-enabled networks and who are ready for your next challenge.
   

  

 At RISE we like difference and we are convinced that diversity contributes to an innovative environment where we together challenge boundaries and develop new knowledge and competence for the future. With us, passionate problem solvers meet to solve some of the world's most important, and perhaps most interesting, problems. We can't promise you a simple job, but what we can promise you is a bunch of dedicated colleagues and some really exciting societal challenges to deal with. You will work in a dynamic environment that gives you development opportunities both professionally and personally. With us you will have the opportunity to make a real difference. Welcome to the Swedish research institute and innovation partner.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 Welcome to contact Joakim Eriksson, Senior Researcher and Head of Unit Connected Intelligence, Tel 070-3213841. The deadline for applications is 2024-10-15. Interviews will be conducted continuously during the application period.

title: ETL (Ab initio) Engineer
description:
**Would you like to join a leading Digital Solution Company and contribute to innovative solutions that are built on a daily basis?**
 Our client is a leading global provider of IT solutions and services, known for their customer-centric approach to digital transformation. With a rich history dating back to 1996, they have continually evolved to meet the changing needs of their customers. Their services encompass consulting, technology, and outsourcing, delivering innovative solutions to complex challenges. They have also been honored multiple times as a top employer, including being named a Great Place To Work from 2015 to 2023.
   

  

 You will work on a long-term project for one of the largest financial institutions in Northern Europe, known for its strong commitment to digital innovation and providing a wide range of financial services to both private and corporate clients.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Developing graphs, plans, creating PSETS, XFR, DML in GDE (Graphical Developer Environment)
* Creating job schedules in Control Center
* Integration to Ab Initio Metadata Hub and several other toolkits
* Table creation in different technologies e.g hive, hbase, Azure SQL, Azure Storage, Teradata, Oracle


**What We Expect**
* 5+ years of similar experience
* Advance ETL and data integration experience (Ab initio, PowerCenter, DataStage..)
* Data Warehouse, Data lake, Big Data and Hadoop or Cloud working experience
* Fluent in any SQL and RDBMS systems
* Unix commands and scripting
* An extra bonus meriting would be knowledge/experience in: DevOps tools (GIT, Jenkins basics) and Azure Cloud
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


**What We Offer**
* B2B contract or employment agreement
* Work-life balance
* Support in learning and development further while also providing multi-year career opportunities
* Stable work in a supportive team
